text:
He querido elegir la Westvleteren Blond para mi nota de cata nº100 en RateBeer. Vamos allá! Botella en 99Cervezas.

Vierte en dorado pajizo, brillante y bastante transparente (salvo una turbidez inicial por frío), con abundante espuma de adherencia y persistencia medias. Buena carbonatación, con multitud de hilos de burbujas mucho tiempo después de servida.

De intensidad media en nariz, da de entrada algunas notas de plátano fresco, pan blanco, algunas notas herbales y un punto cítrico. Poco después aparecen notas de manzana y el punto de hierba fresca se refuerza. Complejidad media o no. Deja que evolucione y se atempere ligeramente y la cerveza cambia a lo belga. Aparecen entonces notas agrestes, casi animales y un puntito rancio interesantísimo. La cerveza cambia mucho conforme pasan los minutos. Increíble evolución!

Muy sorprendente en boca, destacando entre los sabores básicos el amargo, ligeramente astringente, algo acre y hasta con un punto picantito. El dulce y un punto salado están también presentes de fondo, dando una estupenda base al amargo. Hay cervezas que en boca confirman lo que en nariz anunciaban y hay cervezas que te sorprenden, esta es una de las últimas. Fantástico e inesperado sabor! Al igual que en nariz, después de unos minutos evoluciona ganando en notas animales y en carácter.

De peso medio-ligero en boca y textura aterciopelada (en plan a contrapelo, ciertamente). Carácter refrescante. Buena bebestibilidad, incluso después de evolucionar en boca y ganar carácter, lo que resulta tremendamente meritorio. Enorme persistencia y final muy seco. No te cansas de ella.

Una maravilla de cerveza, y una sorprendente evolución en nariz y en boca. Toda una experiencia que todo buen aficionado debería conocer. Total y absolutamente recomendable.
Pours golden in color with that epic westvleteren house yeast strain smell. Banana the ocean and faint apple skin

From bottle at the abbey; pours hazy golden with a white head. Aroma is hoppy with grassy notes and slightly yeasty. Taste is light bitter, yeasty, fresh with slightly citrussy and grassy hops, slightly herbal. Medium bitter, light yeasty finish. Fizzy carbonation, light to medium body. Delicious!

Bottle. Hazy golden to orange colour, large, slowly diminishing, white head. Mild aroma of spice, yeast, phenol, pear, light citrus, lemon. Taste is light sweet and light bitter, spice, pear, citrus, lemon, light phenolic, yeasty. Fruity finish with notes of spices, Light to medium body, average to lively carbonation. Refreshing, but not as good as expected.

Bottle. Hazy yellow. Moderate white well-lacing head. Aroma: fruity and spicy yeast. Pale malts. Music m body. The taste is medium dry, fresh, fruity, spicy. Light to medium ending bitterness. Floral notes. Hops and a hint of nuts on aftertaste. Very good.

A: Cloudy straw with a big white head
N: Refreshing notes of citrus and grain
T: Full-on bitterness. Coriander. Orange zest. 
P: Medium
O: Brilliant abbey ale
33cl bottle. Great beer, on of the best blond beers ive ever drank. Too bad this beer is so hard to get,,,

14/20 it's nice but about on par with a leffe blonde without as much of a boozy taste

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

A bottle from Beers of Belgium drunk at Dads place while home on leave. Aroma: cereal, sweet herbs. Appearance: hazy light gold, 5 mm. of bubbles. Palate: full-bodied and creamy, lively carbonation. Long, predominantly sweet finish with candy. Taste: sweet and bitter, nicely balanced. Very memorable, particularly for such a relatively low ABV.
Drank during visit to Westvleteren & Struise 02-05-17. Very good blond beer. A bit bitter. Comprehensive taste. Some soft "blond-ness". Fine soft carbonation. Good.

Aroma: sweet with some apple juice and white wine; Appearance: cloudy golden pour with thin white head that lingers; Taste: richer and drier than aroma; big flavor for a blonde; Palate: medium body with medium finish; Overall: excellent for a blonde.
UPDATED: MAY 21, 2017 Strong aroma on this blonde. Good balance, no overbearing sweetness. Great example of the style but not exactly in a league of its own like the hype would suggest.

Floral and yeasty, a great exemplary Belgian blonde. Quite carbonated as well. However, if drinking regularly and on a budget, can get an equivalent if not better trappist blonde for a quarter of the price.

Might be "the basic beer for the monks own consumption", but Im finding nothing basic about Westvleteren Blond at all. Perhaps the best pure example of a Belgian single available, Westie Blond hits all the bright, grassy hefe notes you want from a traditional golden Trappiste ale, yet also brings along wonderfully deep Belgian esters to the mix, reaching the perfect ratio of banana to clove against a red apple sweetness. Modest floral hop finish, and the fade gives up bready yeast and a lingering but restrained sweet roll undercurrent. As gorgeous as a beer can be, and the feels perfect. I understand why Westvleteren 12 gets all the attention, but Im a Blond guy through and through.

Aroma: apricot, orange, tangerine, honey, malty, some spicy notes
Taste: light sweet, moderate bitter, apricot, tangerine, honey, some orange

0,33l bottle from Kulminator, Antwerp, courtesy of friend Karol K., many thanks. BBD: 04.04.15 Pours clear dark golden liquid, small creamy white head, Aroma: yeasty, grass, light Belgian phenol, diacetyl, sweet, Taste: light to medium sweet, light bitter, light to medium sour, Belgian phenol, unnatural sweetness, light grass and light fruity, Palate: light body, average carbonation, slick mouthfeel, abrupt sweet finish, Overall: this bottle is gone, should rerate.
Uklar gylden ale med langt hvidt skum. Duft af citrusfrugt og gær. Mild karbonering og bittersød smag med noter af citrudfrugt, gær og krydderier.
UPDATED: JUN 6, 2017 Aroma of sweet clementine & spices. Hazy golden with very long lasting white head. Light sweet & medium bitter. Medium body, thin texture & soft carbonation.

Pours hazy golden orange with a frothy head that lingers. The aroma is overall fruity, dominated by pear, apple, and sparkling white wine. Taste is bittersweet, fruity, light spice, lightly yeasty, with a tart apple undertone. The body stays fairly light. Good.

Butelka z datą: 18.08.2017
AROMAT: Intensywny. Dominują drożdże (fenole: goździki) oraz słody (zboża). W tle nuty estrowe (gruszka).
SMAK: Słodowo-drożdżowe. Posmak przyprawowo-korzenny. Odczucie w ustach: gładkie. Świetnie ukryty alkohol.
WYGLĄD: Barwa żółtozłota, zmętnione. Piana średniej wysokości, szybko znika.
OGÓLNIE: Delikatne, dobrze ułożone.To moje pierwsze spotkanie z trzech zaplanowanych spotkań z "żyjąca legendą" piwnego świata. Czuję lekki zawód, ale wierzę, że teraz może być już tylko lepiej.
Bottle from Voldby. Pours golden yellow with a white head. Aroma and taste is malt, some fruits, yeast, honey, spicy notes. Medium body. Soft carbonation. Yeasty finish.
Drank at In de Vrede. Yellow colour with a nice dense white head. Hoppy aroma and tatse. Refreshening.

Bière blonde, pas trop de mousse, une couleur dorée, quelques "poissons" (faut dire que je les garde depuis au moins 5 ans) elle nen reste pas moins pétillante pour autant, un nez fleuri, herbacé. Elle a un petit peu damertume mais reste très douce, La référence dans les bières trappistes, une incontournable â essayer...

Bottle. Superb blonde a little veiled with a pure white head and sparkling Champagne. Aromas of malt and hop, herbs and fruity, hints of honey. The taste is bitter-sweet, creamy with honey, toffy, fruity and very present hop with notes of grass, flowers and zest of citrus. The Bitterness prevail over the malted sweetness. Long and bitter finale.
A belgian, amber, cloudy Trappist Blonde Ale with white head. Aroma is malt, spices, yeast, light raisins. Taste is bitter.

33cl bottle at home from Plan B, Rotterdam. Nose is apple, peach. Body is opalescent yellow golden, head is very big, creamy rocky, white, fully lasting, excellent lacing. Aroma is apple, peach, banana, wheat malt, yeast, honey. Medium sweet, light bitter, light fruity sour. Finish is medium lasting, fruity malty medium sweet. Light body, silky creamy texture, soft carbonation. Easy, refreshing, perfectly balanced, really good one, probably the best Belgian blond Ive ever had.
Flaska från Matte. Dimmigt ljusgul med vitt skum. Fruktig doft av jäst och skumbanan. Lite avslagen känsla, skumbanan och örter.

UPDATED: JAN 13, 2017 Flaska köpt på beer temple, brygge. Disig gul kulör. Doft av aprikos, äpplemos och belgojäst. Örtig smak med övermogna äpplen, hö och jäst. Lätt jordig och bondig. Lite torr munkänsla med diskret beska
Mooi fris bier voor bij de maaltijd. Aroma is: licht fruitig, gist en wat mout. Smaak is licht fruitig, gist, moutig en een aangenaam bittertje.
Für mich ein eher normales belgisches Blonde, zitrus und leichte Alkohole, typische belgische Hefe. Sehr weiches Mundgefühl und trockener Abgang.
Bottle. Pours yellow / golden, hazy with a small white head. Smells yeast, malt and grapefruit. Aroma is promising, with yeasts, malt, spice and hop, nice and very complex.

Helder blond bier met grote witte schuimkraag. Geur: mout, hoppig, fruitig, bloemig, geparfumeerd. Smaak: gistkarakter, een lekkere bitterheid maar niet overdreven, licht fruitig, perzik. Medium koolzuurprikkel. Afdronk: licht bitter.
Leicht trübes goldgelb mit reichlich Schaum. Malzig, hefig, blumig, etwas Honig, Zitrusaromen, pfeffrig, cremig, sehr süffig.

Aged four years. Bottle. Trappist glass. Golden, lightly hazy with small, semi-thick, white head. Aroma is mainly yeasty, citric, malty and fruity. Lightly grassy. Taste is very refreshing, fruity the sweetness is not really pronounced here, rather firm and clear malty profile, in the end lightly to moderately bitter. Light to medium body, watery to oily texture, average carbonation, finish is malty, lightly bitter and smooth. In general this one is like good German Pilsener with some light Belgian yeasty profile ;) Not the best not the worst just above average.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer.

Aromat kwiatowy kojarzący się z plastrem miodu, lekkie nuty drewna oraz lekka pomarańcza/cytryna. W smaku bardzo kwiatowe z przyjemną nienachalną goryczką, chce się więcej. Z całej trójki poleciłbym to piwo najbardziej.

Slightly hazy golden colour with a thin head that vanishes almost instantly. Aroma is honey and yeast. Oily texture, though the carbonation is a bit much. Taste is more of the same. If this is what these monks get to drink every day, then I might just convert.

UPDATED: MAY 27, 2017 På flaska. Dimmigt halmgul med mycket tjockt vitt skum. Doftar torrt, gräs, säd samt lite bränd karamell. Smaken mycket fyllig med beska, lite söta toner. Eftersmaken lång och lite besk.

Erg lekker blond bier. Zachte, ietwat bittere afdronk. Na een tijdje komen de frisse aromas goed vrij. Zeker een van de betere blonde bieren, of speelt de naam en faam van Westvleteren toch onbewust mee in mijn overwegingen? En maar 5,8% alcohol. De meeste andere bieren die ik zo kan waarderen hebben toch een veel hoger alcoholpercentage...

Kolor: słomkowy, delikatnie zamglony.
Piana: obfita, drobnopęcherzykowa, dość wolno opada, utrzymuję się cienka warstwa.
Zapach: słodki, sodowy, lekko miodowy, lekko estrowy, owocowy.
Smak: wyraźna pełnia, słodycz, nuty estrowe, owocowe, lekka goryczka, całość dość ciężka.
Wysycenie: średnie.

UPDATED: NOV 20, 2016 A hazy pale gold colour with a medium sized tight white head. Sweet bready, citrus yeasty aroma with a little spice. Clean sweet  flavour, bread, citrus fruit, spicy and yeasty. The yeasty spiciness coming through in the finish.
Medium white head, golden yellowish coloured body, citrus floral yeasts smell, floral some honey yeasty herbs peppery taste

Mooi goudblond bier met romige witte schuimkraag die goed aan het glas blijft plakken. Aroma van hooi, gerst, licht zuurtje. Vol en romig in de mond. Gist, witte druif, kandijsuiker, tarwe. Mooie zachte afdronk. Een van de betere blonde (trappisten)bieren.

330ml bottle purchased online. 5.8%alc./vol. Pours a hazy deep gold colour with one finger of lasting white head. Aromas of bread and yeast. Nothing impressive. Taste matches the aroma with notes of citrus and finishes dry. Medium bodied with moderate carbonation. Taste similar to Duvel blond. I recommend Westy 8 and 12 over this one.
Sweet cereal and yeast aroma. Malty clean and satisfying. Slight dryness at the end but the bitterness is very mild and balancing. Quite simple but really delicious.

Bottle @home. Pours golden slight and i do mean slight haze, biggish white head, great lacing. Nose is esters, banana, slight peach, mango and general tropical fruits. Taste is peach, tropical fruits, a really nice slightly bitter aftertaste. Slightly yeasty as it warms, there is almost a champagne taste to this.

Shared bottle. Hazy bronze appearance with a large fluffy white head. Moderate lacing. Aroma of light malt, yeast, spice and mild fruitiness. Taste is yeast, spice, bread, mild fruitiness. Finish is mildly bitter and dry. Quite good.

UPDATED: OCT 10, 2016 Pours a hazy gold from the bottle at the cafe with fluffy white head that dissipates slowly to leave moderate lace. Aroma of light fruity Belgian yeast esters and pale malts. Taste follows, clean and simple, dry, slightly bitter finish. A nice low alcohol one to start with at their pub. Refreshing and light.

Couple bottles at The Sovereign, most recently yesterday at Zwanze Day 2016 courtesy of solidfunk, thanks for sharing Josh! Cloudy yellow with lite offwhite head. Wheat, herbs, hay, lite citrus, yeast. Nothing really jumps out, which is what makes this a great Belgian ale for me. Just very nicely integrated flavors and notes.
Light straw and lots of florals. Hazy blonde pour with light caramel. Very well balanced and well done. Light citrus. Bottle at Sovereign.

Pullo @ 2Be, Brugge. Kaatuu lasiin kullankeltaisena ja kirkkaana, noin 2 sormen paksuisella vaahdolla. Tuoksussa on perinteiseen belgiblonden tyyliin yrttisyyttä, hiivaisuutta, pippuria ja raikasta sitruunaa. Maussa yrttisyys ja mausteisuus jatkuu, hedelmäisyyttä ja sitruunankuorta on myös joukossa. Suutuntuma on hiilihappoinen ja suht raikas, hiiva tuo täyteläisyyttä. Monimuotoinen blonde, joka on kuin tripel hieman raikkaampana.

Bottle 0,33. Pours clear yellow with large white head, good retention. Aroma of hay, flowers, yeast, grain, a bit dusty. Taste of flowers, hay, some malts, yeast, cereal and lasting bitterness in the aftertaste. Lively carbonation, medium body.
Świetne piwo, bardzo dobrze zbalansowane, ułożone - zwłaszcza, że pite niemal rok po terminie. Piękna piana, złocista barwa, nieco za duże nagazowanie.

Wonderful aromas of flowers, light yeast and lightly fruity. Lovely taste similar scent. Good bitterness that fills the mouth for a long time. Good beer but becoming more bitter when it gets warmer. Follow me @ Kung av öl @ Facebook for more pictures and ratings.

Bottle in Seattle, generously delivered by Alberto earlier this year. Lacing foam, light grainy straw color. Light honey grain aroma. Pale, bitter and dry. Some honey sweetness with crusty bread. Solid, clean beer. But not exceptional. As with the 12, I just wish I could have this whenever I wanted: its a real, honest drinker. So nice.

Big thanks to Matt for sharing this one. Hazy golden pour. Slightly toasted malts, like a light, crusty bread. Especially on the nose. Matt put this well: Its not outstanding, but I cant find fault with it, and I so wish I could drink this all the time.

Bottle. Pours a slightly hazy golden yellow with a fluffy white head and lots of dark yeast particles from cellaring. Aromas of some citrus, floral, clove, banana. Flavor follows the nose with lemon, floral, hay, grass, slight clove and banana. Light body, slick texture, lively carbonation, dry finish.

Clear golden pour with loads of visible carbonation bubbling to the top. Single finger fluffy white head. Aroma is flowery and light with hints of bubblegum. Very yeast forward. Light bodied with tons of carbonation. Light and flowery taste, hints of cereal and grain along with flowery hops and a slight peppery bite. Finish is yeast forward. Highly quaff able.
Flesje gekregen met verjaardag en thuis gedronken. Goudgeel, licht troebel bier met stevige witte schuimkraag. Weinig aroma. Ietsje fruitig. Smaak van citrusvruchten en hop. Nasmaak is iets bitter.

Dark blond with white and foamy head. Nose: herbal, alcohol at first, followed by slitly ester. Taste: light sweet fruit (apricot) at first, followed by a sharp and persistent bitterness. Light body. High carbonation. Enjoyable and refreshing.

ASPETTO: biondo carico, abbastanza torbida. Schiuma bianca, fine, abbondante e decisamente persistente. AROMA: speziato, erbaceo, leggero vino bianco. GUSTO: inizia leggermente fruttata, per poi evolvere in un amaro abbastanza deciso che permane nel lungo e stretto retrogusto. Il tutto accompagnato da un delicato floreale. Scivola benissimo e disseta. Carbonizzazione elevata, corpo leggero.

Amarelo palha escuro, média turbidez, espuma branca de boa formação e média persistência. Aroma bastante adocicado, doce de leite, banana madura. Médio dulçor e baixo amargor. Corpo leve média carbonatação. Final diminui um pouco o dulçor e incrementa levemente o amargor, média persistência, paladar aveludado.

F: big, white, long lasting.
C: pale yellow, hazy, non-transparent.
A: malt, floral hops, spicy, hint of orange, grassy, apricot, perfume, herbal.
T: malty, long lasting grassy floral bitterness, coriander, orange peels, bready, creamy mouthfeel, light earthy, wheat, lemon, apricot, perfume, yeast, fruity, medium body, good carbonation, worth to try and the best in In de Vrede from tap, 0,33l on tap in In de Vrede 8. June 2016
Mooie trappistenbier. Persoonlijk had ik hogere verwachtingen bij dit bier. Kwaliteit komt niet in de buurt van de prijs.

happy with the privilege to drink this beer. I thought it would be highly overated, its not a full body taste, but has a lot of fine aromas with a good combination.I wont buy it again because of the price.
Hazy orange with plenty of yeast sediment. Huge white foam. Yeasty aroma, some citrus, some clove. Clove and bready malt flavors. Could be some coriander too.

Bottle at home. Pours clearish golden, lots of yeast in the bottle, small white dense head. Nose is sweet fruits, dried fruits, peppery spicy yeast, apples, creamy. Taste is creamy, quite bitter, dry, floral, light fruits, straws, light spices. Solid blonde, quite dry and bitter for my taste. Considering the name and fame I expected more.

UPDATED: JUL 16, 2016 Golden yellow pour with white head that lasts on the sides. Nose is a mix between trappist and rose petals. Taste is sweet honey wheat and that heavy trappist alcohol with yeasty aftertaste, slightest bitter on the palate. Very balanced blond!

Bottle sample tasted at BBF Lab Madrid 2016 on the 02/07/2016. Hazy dark golden colour with a big white head. Aroma and taste of yeast, fruits and some resin. Aftertaste is medium dry and bitter. Next one please!

Amber with frothy white head which settles quickly with little lacing. Plenty of yeast in the bottle. 
Fruity and malty aroma with some creamy notes. Palate is smooth and mouthfilling, soft carbonation. The aroma is a veritable mix of sweet fruits and berries which settles is some bitterness. Very pleasant.

Bottiglia. Il gusto al naso riconosce il luppolo. Lintensità olfattiva è normale e la persistenza olfattiva è sufficiente. Il cappello è di schiuma cremosa e persistente, a bollicine medie. Laspetto del liquido è velato. Il perlage ha bollicine fini. La carbonazione è abbondante, persistente ed insistita. Il colore è giallo dorato. Il corpo è strutturato ma duttile. Il dolce è medio, mentre lamaro è leggero. Lintensità gustativa è elevata e la persistenza gustativa è buona. Il gusto è piacevole. Le sensazioni boccali finali sono da favola perché è una birra elegante. Il finale è lungo, secco e pulito. Il retrogusto è intenso. Laroma in bocca riporta sentori di crosta di pane, cereali, agrumi, erbe aromatiche e fiori.

A 330ml bottle with a minimum sell-by date of 29th October 2016 and poured into a Chimay goblet glass. It poured a hazy golden orange colour with a small amount of sediment and a nice puffy two finger white head with good retention and leaves great lacing. Actually, despite the sediment, this looks amazing. Aromas are bready, clove and banana with a hint of peppery spice and apple pie. Tastes of strong breadiness but with clove and banana sweetness and a hint of bubblegum. Creamy, medium bodied with moderate carbonation. Overall, wow Actually this surprised me as its often overshadowed by the 12 and even 8, but I really enjoyed this. As a Belgian Pale Ale, it seems to be one of the best of its style and has great balance, very refreshing and easy to drink.
UPDATED: FEB 22, 2017 Barwa jasna, ładna pianka. Piwo bardzo ładnie się prezentuje w szkle. Aromat mocny i wyraźny. Przyjemna goryczka na finiszu. Bardzo solidne Belgian Ale.
How: bottle Appearance: cloudy light golden with a medium to small white head. aroma: spice, orange peel, herbs, apples, floral, fresh yeast and some honey. Palate: medium body, average carbonation.

Bottle at In de Vrede. Hazy golden with thin creamy white head. Aroma of floral hops, honey and some citrus. Taste is medium bitter, light sweet malts. Medium body, soft carbonation. Nicely balanced and tasty ale.
33 cl. bottle. Hazy dark golden colour with a big white head. Aroma and flavour of yeast, fruit, spice, dry and bitter.
33cl bottle. Hazy, golden with a thick white head. Bready, yeasty aroma, taste is fruit, yeast, floral, alcohol in the finish. Excellent blonde beer

Golden hazy with rich off-white head. Strong yeasty aroma. Good bitterness folowwed by strong yeast fruity notes. Strong carbonation. Touch if sweet around the tongue. Strong lasting herbaly bitte aftertaste.
Bottle. Orange color, stable white head. Aroma is biscuity, spicy, floral with oranges. Taste is medium sweet, nice hoppy, fruity and spicy. Full body, nice balanced

goud blond met een blijvende witte kop, alle smaken een lekkere bitterhop , citrusfruit en bloem boeket, die met elke zacht bubbel elkaar afwisselen door eenvoud en kracht een heuse sensatie zo niet godswonder
Big thanks to ygtbsm94 for this bottle. Light yeast lemon floral soft so soft blonde ale. Something so different and mellow.

At In de Vrede. Medium golden. Gorgeous frothy lasting white head. Moderate bitterness. Earthy hops. Smooth medium body. Not overcarbonated as with other Belgian brews. Perfect balance and mouthfeel. Absolutely excellent. Exceeded my expectations.
Light and crisp, surprisingly earthy. A little bitter. Lighter than many Belgium beers.

Westvleteren Blonde. Excelente patersbier/single/enkel dessa lendária cervejaria belga. Rótulo bem difícil de conseguir, já que todo mundo corre atrás da cultuada XII. Cor dourada, com turbidez dentro do estilo, creme de boa formação. Aroma frutado, lembrando frutas amarelas. Na boca, carbonatação bem presente, entregando uma breja equilibradissima, com dulçor controlado e amargor bem evidente. Talvez seja uma das trapistas mais lupuladas que já tomei. Notas terrosas, herbáceas. Final seco, altíssima drinkability. Enfim, uma Breja para se contemplar mesmo. Complexidade e sutileza se blendam nos 5.8% de álcool, perceptíveis somente no final do gole. Uma pérola esquecida dessa respeitada cervejaria belga. Agradeço aqui o sograo por ter trazido esse presentasso de viagem. Cheers! 4.75/5 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle poured and split at Toms. Cloudy golden yellow pour. Straw like aroma. Flavor is dry for the most part, lemon partial. Consistent yeast character. Dry leather and yeast finish. Very fun beer to finally try, but for me, its more of a standard belgian ale, opposed to something that stands out like expected. Cant complain though, standard belgians are good.
Bottle - Nice sweet grains. Cloudy gold with a decent white head. Sweet honey notes and soft grains. Nice.

In de Vrede, Westvleteren, at the terrace. 33 cl bottle. Pours lemon yellow, cloudy, long-lasting white head. Aroma is bread, porridge, lemon, spearmint. Full-bodied, fizzy, a little thin. Some bitterness, some metallic, medium persistence.
Mousse blanche, couleur jaune orangé, arôme de levures, en bouche levures, légèrement coriandre et clou de girofle, typique des trappistes.Belle rondeur. 33 Cl In de Vede

Trappistenflasche (@Rudat, Oespel, 0.33l 13.33!): Golden, cloudy, floaties visible, small & stable creamy head; moderate fruity and yeasty nose; moderate to solid bitter-sweet flavour, medium bodied, creamy MF; lingering bitter and fruity finish, some residual malty sweetness detectable. Surely good, but totally overrated

29/04/2016 @home - 33cl bottle bought @ In De Vrede.
Hazy blond with creamy white head. Nose is grains, fruits a bit floral. Taste is sweet fruits, bitter fruits, some spices. Wow, didnt expect to like this that mu h. One of the loveliest blondes I ever drank!
Bottle 33cl. Hazy yellow with a sturdy bright white head. Aroma of malts, sugar, peaches. Fresh bitter taste with an even more bitter aftertaste. Dry for a blond beer but still very good.

Buena cerveza, fácil de tomar y muy fresca. Buenas notas a lupulo herbal, algo amarga pero con buen equilibrio.
En lo personal me sorprendió la intensidad de notas especiadas, principalmente canela y clavo.
Z butelki w barze przy klasztorze St. Sixtus. Bardzo klasyczny, bezbłędny i smaczny blond.

UPDATED: FEB 23, 2017 Przeklejka wyjazdowa, wiec bez wrazen glebszych, pite w klasztorze: Trappist Westvleteren BlondBrouwerij De Sint-Sixtusabdij van WestvleterenNo kuzwa :) W rzeczy samej :)In De VredeOcena potraktowana skryptem do przeliczania ocen (uzgodnienie UT/RB).
Nice blond beer, very bitter and dry finish. Nice yeast aroma. But honestly, more legendary than tasty. Nothing compared to the marvelous XII from the same abbey
Ladna biala piana, zolta metna piana. W aromacie bardzo delikatne estry, fenole i kwiaty. W smaku wszystko, co dobry sesyjny blond powinien miec. Lekko drozdzowe w odczuciu. Srednio nasycone.

UPDATED: MAY 24, 2016 Bottle 33cl bought at Schaliënhuis. Pours hazy dark golden with a medium white head. Nose: malts, bitter, grain, rice, hay, citruszeste. Taste: medium carbonation. A combination of malts and hay with notes of cardemom and rice followed by notes of citruszeste. The aftertaste  is a not so pleasant bitterness and a dry feeling. I cant understand such the high ranking...

Enjoyed this one at Pub Italia, Ottawa, ON, with Chopz. Poured into an immense glass chalice/goblet, it has a pretty good size foamy head, and keeps a thin layer to the end. Has a hazy light orange appearance. Lots of carbonation. Yeasty sediments are quite visible (bottled mid 11) Great retention and active carbonation throughout. Has orange/citrus, pears and yeasty aromas. Very strong orange flavour. Some citric type flavours bordering on tropical, sort of mild mango. Some spices as well. The finish has a hint of hop in the taste, not much in aromas. Good tangy mouthfeel, smooth going down. For my first real Belgian Trappist ale, quite pleased!

From bottle to St. Sixtus chalice. Bottle purchased at a bottle shop in Brugge in September 2014. Beautiful aroma of light sweet malt, wheat like, yeast well pronounced with phonolics and perfume. Hazy yellow with chunks of the yeast. White head is moderate with very limited lacing on the glass. Creamy mouthfeel. Taste is banana, wheat malt and yeast.
Bouteille 33cl à la maison, mousse quasi inexistante, odeur miel, clou de girofle. Goût: vanille, caramel abricot, légére et désaltérant, amertume légére, finale séche

Hazy golden colour. Yeast deposit comes in hard pieces. Grainy nose with strong yeast character of classic witbeer (fruity, spicy). Initially full body with good carbonation. Taste is very grainy combined with fruity spicy yeast. Good beer but surely overhyped. Classic blond.

Thick white head, hazy yellow with yeast clumps. Smell of citrus, herbal, grainy, light phenolics, similarities to some wit beers. High carbonation, lots of fresh grain, tart, full body. Overall very good balance but not tooo exciting.

Rating #1121, flaske fra The Bottle Shop, Brügge  

 Lys gul, tåget øl med luftigt, men holdbart flødeskumsagtigt skum. Udseendet er perfekt. Aroma er ikke ekstraordinær, men meget frisk og indeholder græs, citrus, krydret humle og en pilsner-agtig syrlighed. Sød, men frisk med smag af græs, citrus, krydret humle og småkager. Afslutningen med en markant, skarp bitterhed. Ikke nyskabende smag i sig selv, men absolut en tørstslukker i topklasse. Den er silkeblød og cremet i munden, med en tilpas afdæmpet kulsyre - her er der ikke en finger at sætte på noget.

Bottle. Hoppy and yeasty aroma. Grassy, herbal, spicy, banana. The flavours start light sweet and finish light bitter. A lingering taste of some Spice that is striking my tongue. The body is light and the texture is oily. I dont get the fuzz about this one...
Hazy orange with a small head. Aroma is Honey, grass and hops. Taste is herbs, hops and honey.

Bottle at Bierhuyske, Antwerp. Hazy pale yellow with s dense white head. Grassy hoppy aroma with pale malty notes. Quite grassy and light herbal flavor with pale malty side hints. Dont really get the fuzz about this. Its good but not outstanding. Easy drinkable though.

(Westvleteren Blond) Bottle 330 ml at home, served into a chalice. ABV 5.8%
Pale golden orange colour on the body with good activity in it, mostly clear body, with one finger of thick white head on top, very good retention.
Aroma of malts, honey, apricot, faint peach.
Taste is sweet with some grains, light malts, apricot, perfume, light peach, faint floral notes.
Medium body with good carbonation.
Not bad and easy to drink but nothing very special either.
The aroma is faintly similar to the dubbel and quad. No notice hop aroma and a surprisingly thin body. However, it's a very drinkable and flavorful beer.

Bottle 33cl. Poured into a Westvleteren chalice. Clear medium golden, good thick frothy white head, good retention and lacing; aroma malty, yeast, light banana, bit of orange, grass; taste medium sweet and bitter, malty, yeasty, light fruity, spicy notes, with long duration, mild dry bitter finish, herbal notes; medium body, creamy texture, smooth mouthfeel, soft carbonation; excellent blond: complex, elegant and well-balanced.

330 ml bottle split with GenDV138 at The Sovereign. Thanks Donnie! Poured a very lightly hazy yellow color with an off-white head. Might be sediment from the bottle more than anything else. Aroma was light herbal, wheat, with a very light lemon peel. Flavor was wheat, light citrus. Tasty notes of light malt, citrus. Solid representation of the style.

330 ml bottle split with radagast83 at The Sovereign. Clear straw yellow with off-white head. Aromas of herbs, citrus, malt, light wheat. Tastes of herb, malt, wheat, light citrus, light caramel. Medium-light body with a dry finish.

Bouteille. Nez de levures fruitées (agrumes, notes dabricots et de poire), malté de miel floral avec des notes de grains pâles, épicé (léger de cannelle, notes de coriandre, de poivre et de clou de girofle) léger de houblon floral et herbeux. Moyennement ronde en bouche avec un pétillement moyen-fort (croustillant) et une texture crémeuse et asséchante. Goût de levures fruitées (agrumes et zeste, notes de poires et dabricots) avec un goût épicé (léger de coriandre, notes de poivre, de clou de girofle, et de cannelle) et des notes de malt pâle croustillant lors de lentrée en bouche suivi dun goût malté de miel très floral avec des notes de biscuit sucré et de pain parallèlement à un goût moyennement amère et sec de houblon floral et herbeux ainsi quun goût de levures et ce, jusquen finale avec quelques notes poivrées. Arrière-goût moyen-long et sec, moyennement amer de levures et de houblon floral et herbeux avec un goût fruité (zeste dagrumes). [notes 2006]

Aroma: Bread, fruits, belgium yeasts.
Appearance: Pale, hazy, foamy 3-fingers head.
Taste: Medium sweet, light bitter, fruity, grassy.
Palate: Medium body, average to lively carbonation, bittersweet finish.
Overall: Perfectly balanced, very tasty, great example of belgian pale/blond ale.
Very aromatic, grainy, bubblegum, citrus on the aroma. Flavor is super light, citrus, grains. Super drinkable! Best blond ive tried for sure.

Bottle at home watching the England / Ireland game, 27th February 16. Pours straw yellow, nice neat little white head. Aroma is hop, yeast, grass, floral. Taste is bitter, clean hop, fresh, yeast, floral, slight honey, lingering bitterness. Palate is low to medium, perfect for the style. Very nice Belgian Ale, but not worth the premium 11 Euro price tag, when compared to the De Ranke and Orval for a quarter of the price.

At the Westvleteren cafe "In de Vrede" on the beginning of May 2013. Hazy blonde beer with white head. Aroma is quite hoppy and citrous. Fresh hoppy bitterness and yeast notes in the taste. It tastes more like IPA, but not a Belgian Blonde. Very original beer compared to other Trappist beers. Very good!
Gedronken in In De Vrede. Fris blond bier, licht metalig van smaak, maar verder moutig en fruitig (citrus). Mooi zomerbier.

Aroma: citrus, belgian yeast spicyness
Taste: yeast, citrus, some peach
A good beer, would be perfect to have cold while in the summer sun

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: APR 27, 2017 33 cl bottle at home. Pours pale golden blonde with medium white head. Foam is soft. Aroma: toast, roasted nuts, coriander, nori. Taste: medium sweetness with medium bitterness. Bitter finish. Bread, honey, lemon zest, coriander and yeast notes. Texture is oily with soft carbonation.

courtesy of [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */, thanks a lot for sharing! slightly tart nose with hints of dry cider, wood, honey and pollen; most remarkable is this surprising depth of taste while the alcohol remains hidden throughout and the taste itself stays quite simple (light tartness, ripe apples, a bit wood, honey) but perfectly balanced. Truly artful.

#456Bottle 0.33l. Hazy deep yellow body, medium white head. Sweet aroma of honey, fruits (greengages and hint of apples), malts. Taste is dry with very slightly bitter finish. Malts, hint of yeast and apricot, honey. Medium body and carbonation. Very well balanced ale.
Bottle 0.33l. A bit cloudy, straw colored. AROMA- lightly sweet, honey, fruity, Belgian yeast. FLAVOR- dry, moderately bitter, malty, Belgian character, clean. Medium bodied.Very good.

Bottle. Pours a cloudy golden orange with a lasting foamy white head. Aroma of citrus, bread, caramel, wheat, pepper. Taste is of bread, caramel, pine, honey, pepper, sunflower seeds. Smooth foamy mouthfeel, soft to medium carbonation.

33cl bottles, 6pack from source bbxx (smudged) tasted side by side with Orval. - Haystack blonde pour that becomes cloudy after pouring 2/3, downright yeast-dirty before pouring 4/5 of bottle - looks like a very strippable UFO depot. Gorgeous yeast eyes on the dented white blanket. - Bouquet is roomfillingly fresh-and-funky, as complex as aged Orval (pity I cant find out which batch this is), essential oils dispensed with lighthearted delicacy: lemon verbena, elderflower and lilac blossom, whole hedgerows of green hop bines and dirty haystack, old Moroccan pickled lemons - loads of organic layers here to be sniffed, none of them soapy from dryhopping(?). - - Flavours delivered to an unsuspecting palate with apéritive dryness and very fervent carbonation: freshly baked white dough rolls sopped in pickled lemon brine, delicate candied pear notes, seasoned with white pepper, minty basil, &c. &c. The fervent overcarbonation of this (aged?) sample is well-cushioned by doughy malt cream. - Finishes dry and yeast bitter, on a grainy pilsner malt note combined with a juicier bitter lemon fruitiness that urges you to mercykill that 6pack faster than you can go and queue back up in line. - The well hidden sessionable holy grail in the trinity thats been overpraised(/undersold) to the skies. Merely sniffing the empty bottle might just qualify for redemption on a bad day.

This beer is like a hidden champion and so underrated because of the ultimate Westy 12. Very complex, delicate fruity, spicy yeast aroma. Flavor is sweet like a high quality honey, fruity, little bit spicy, very drinkable and tasty. Sad that you cant age this beer.

Unclear, some small floaters, golden colored, medium white head, good lasting. Aroma is brewing sugar, spices, Belgian yeast, spicy-peppery, bit lemon citric. Taste is medium- sweet malt, brewing sugar, spices-coriander, some fruity notes, very spicy and Belgian yeasty, hay-straw, low lemon, medium bitterness, dry finish. Medium bodied, average carbonation.

At a tasting, many thanks, stable bubbly head, hazy lemon yellow color, aroma of white fruit, herbal tea, overipe oranges and lots of brett earthiness over it, flavor of spice and melon with earth and roots and a nutty hint, light pleasant bitterness. Tasty and really really good.
Denne blond har et lyst grumset udseende med et medium hvidt skum. Øllen har en sød citrus-frugtig aroma og smager igennem af citrus med en medium bitterhed. Medium karbonering.

Pale yellow color with nice thick foam and also a lot of particles. A caramel nose with a sweetish alcoholic cookie touch. The taste is sweet, a little flat, a little grainy and has also a light cookie note. The aftertaste is dry and underwhelming.
Golden color with white head. Aroma is grainy, spicy, some fruits, maybe banana, maybe a bit apricot. Taste is similar, slightly grainy, again fruits. Quite dry mouthfeel, refreshing. Not bad.
Bottle, courtesy of SinH4. A beautiful sweet Belgian blond. Dry and crisp, refreshing, rich. Aroma of Malzbier.

Amarela levemente turva e com média formação de espuma de boa duração. No aroma notas cítricas, destaque para laranja, frutas secas, com presença de damasco, especiarias e levedura. O sabor reproduz o aroma sendo mais cítrico e condimentado. Corpo médio, com final longo, meio sendo e frutado presente no retrogosto. Uma excelente Blond, representa muito bem as cervejas produzidas na abadia de St. Sixtus
Clear yellow-green liquid, average head. Aroma of fruits and hops. Light body, strong carbonation. Taste is bitter and sour.

Bottle, with thanks to bytemesis! This is a Westy Ive been wanting to try for quite awhile, so I was pleasantly surprised to find this included in the box he sent my way. Gold pour, short-lived white head. Aroma is dusty. Faded honey, some oxidation, and orange blossom. Resonates with apple cider notes as well, but in the way that De Dolle sometimes does, not in the "flawed apple cider" way. I get the impression this has some age on it, but its really well-composed and distinguished. Taste is dry and dusty. Medium- body, gentle on the palate. Overall: excellent. I sure hope I make it to Belgium one of these days to find these beauties at the source.

Chris opened this treasure tonight. Let me try to express how amazing that is. This is, I believe, the only beer that (1) was on my wants list almost immediately after joining the site 10 years ago, and (2) that I still havent tried, and (3) I still want to try. That makes it a pretty rare bird and pretty great thing to get to drink.

Absolutely gorgeous pour, glowing gold with a small white head into...yes...a Westy chalice. The nose is dust and hay, enticing. The flavor is spectacular. Its very dusty, just the way I love Belgian farmhouse beers, but its also spectacular in its intense orange rind of the sort that you get in a good tripel. But its got absolutely none of the sweetness of some tripels, none of the fruity esters. Instead its just bone dry, with a cider-like aspect that is very unusual among the 2000+ beers that Ive had. The mouthfeel is right on the mark for weight on the tongue. Not thick and sticky, not thinner than one would like.

Sipping this I drift off into a fantasy where Ive living in rural Belgium and this is the local equivalent of Sierra Nevada Pale Ale, where you can just crack bottle and bottle and drink deep while hanging out with your friends...aaah. So nice.

Chris, thank you enormously for sharing this treasure.  Unlike whatever  random Scandinavian double imperial stouts and Midwestern tap-only IPAs I had on my wants list a decade ago, this one has stood the test of time.

tl;dr summary: Westy, biatches.

Butelka, spożyte w domu. Kolor złoto pomarańczowy, mętnawy, piana drobnoziarnista długo się trzyma.Po otwarciu butelki aromat cytrynowy mocno wyczuwalny. Aromaty ulatniają się intensywnie, smak cytrusów, słodu i lekki drożdżowy.Wysycenie i goryczka O.K. na średnim poziomie. Na podniebieniu owoce, banany, lekka goryczka.Wadą jest mała butelka i cena.
Pięknie ułożone piwo.

UPDATED: JUN 14, 2016 33cl bottle at home. Pours a sligjt hazy golden colour with a small white head. Aroma of honey, yeast, malts, orange. Taste is sweet with a slight bitterness to it with notes of biscuit, fruits, yeast. and a slight coriander-like note. Texture is creamy with medium carbonation.

Robe blonde profonde, belle mousse. Nez houblon, agrumes, levures, note maltée. Bouche à lattaque fraîche, fruitée, minérale, bulle élégante et longue finale raffraîchissante. Une très belle bière parfaitement équilibrée.
25.10.2015- Glas In de Vrede,goldgelb mit Weisser Krone, Antrunk fruchtig, malzig und hopfig - ein geniales Blonde

330 ml bottle
White golden orange clear beer with big fluffly persistent head. Aroma has Belgian yeast, honey, pepper and pear peel. Flavor has belgian yeast, honey, pepper and herbs. Palate is medium full with quite mild carbonation and slight btiterness. Finish has quite mild bitterness. Aftertaste is herbal and honeyish with a bit watery feel. Pouring in the sediment makes it quite hazy and adds some sweetness and body. Nice aroma but lacks carbonation and hops.
Esta cerveja é perfeita. Gosto muito agradavel, amargor ideal. Foi a melhor cerveja que ja bebi. Pena ser tao dificil de encontrar.

2013 bottle shared by Cuso. Aroma intensely spicy perfumey. Hazy golden colour, moderately stable head. Taste is also quite perfumey, spicy, with a strong biscuity malty base but not overly sweet. Nicely balance, rich in flavour. Very good.
Bottle shared by Cuso, thanks. Pours bit hazy golden color, white head. Aroma of grapes, malty, orange. Taste is medium sweet, lightly bitter, wood, malt, nuts, yeasty, apricot.

Bottle thanks to oldrtybastrd, thanks again for sending me this 
Pours hazy dirty dark orange, small white head, light lacing. Aroma is fruity, sweet malts, yeast and apples. Flavor is malty, fruity, biscuity, citrus with a crisp, dry finish 
Nice and tasty

Hazy yellow colour. Big long lasting head. Aroma of hops, yeast and spices. Dry and smooth malty flavor and also in the background spices and floral hops. Finish off with a nice bitterness. A very easy drinking beer.
Een goed blond Belgisch biertje, te verkrijgen in de abdij zelf. Ideaal met paterskaas erbij.

Slight fruity, citrus, yeast and bread aroma; hazy, golden yellow colour, big frothy long-life off-white head; medium body; medium carbonation; sweet malty and bread taste; spicy, fruity and slight bitter palate.

At a first a wonderfull blonde... But than again (like their double) a soapy unpleseant finish. I think it?s from the yeast. Taste: Vanilla, citrus, pineapple, banana, spices, soap. Overall a reconizable Westvleteren taste which is good. But their 8 and blond has this soapy, parfume, chemical taste.
hazy gold yellow pour. aroma barley bread yeast slight honey. slight vanilla bitter. finish of perfume.

33cl bottle @ St. Sixtus. Pours very intense golden with medium white head...shines as gold! Lots of lemon and cereals on the nose. Taste is balanced: malt, yeast and hops work so good together. Theres also a slight banana touch. Dry on the palate, kicks hard but vanishes fast. Of course, no alcohol flavour at all. Medium body, perfect carbonation. Delicious.

On tap, 33cL. @In de Vresde. A pale yellow opaque beer with a medium thick white head ; medium retention. Fruity aroma (citrus), herbs, light resin, light biscuit. Light sweet, light to medium herbal lasting bitter. Light to medium body, silky texture, smooth, good carbonation, herbal citrusy finish. Overall, really glad to have tasted this beer, season-like ; light, well-balanced, silky.

330 ml bottle from Etre Gourmet.
Golden-amber, hazy body, with floating sediments and a big, frothy, moderately lacing, white head.
Aroma is quite light, with citrus, sweet fruits, spices, yeast, some bread.
Tastes of lemongrass, citrus, sweet bread, Brett, dried fruits, some spices, some young cheese.
Medium, a bit creamy mouthfeel, with a moderate carbonation.
Finishes smooth, dry, a bit sour, a bit bitter, a bit spicy, yeasty, fruity and a bit sweet.

Very nice. Fresh, smooth and very well balanced, but Im still missing the last bit of extraordinariness for such a highly rated beer. Overall a quaffable Belgian ale how I like, but not my favourite style example.

Direct bij het openen van fles een flink fris pittig citrus aroma met een bite met kruidige tinten. Een aroma dat al doet blijken dat het mooi in balans is. Mooi hoppig diep aroma. Forse wolkige schuimkraag en een lichte troebeling bij het inschenken. Komt vrij zacht maar sprankelend binnen maar weet zich in de afdronk overweldigend uitbundig te ontwikkelen. Prachtige carbonatie, niet te zacht niet te fel. Een mooie warme bittere bite (pittige) komt tevoorschijn die niet al te indringend is. Alles is in een unieke mooie balans. Laat zich makkelijk weg drinken. Het doet denken aan Achel Blond met een broodachtige smaak. Ik nam westvleteren altijd met een korreltje zout door de hype en de mythe.. maar dit is een geweldig blond bier! Uitmuntend!

Dorata leggermente carica, velata dai lieviti in sospensione, schiuma bianca mediamente persistente.
Aroma di chiodi di garofano e miele d'acacia in primo piano, note balsamiche ed erbacee.
Al palato riconfermate le caratteristiche olfattive con in aggiunta una bella nota di frumento che successivamente passa ad un leggero erbaceo.
Corpo medio-leggero, non molto carbonata.
Molto elegante, un capolavoro nel suo genere, quest'abbazia è una vera e propria garanzia.
Bottle at BBF LAb. Golden colour with white head. Honey and malt aroma. Sweet, honey and matl taste. Medium body.
330ml bottle at home. Very good Belgian blonde ale, well-balanced, a little hoppy bitterness but very refreshing.
Pours a cloudy golden yellow with a frothy white head. Aroma like a typical belgian ale with citrus, light hops and a bit of yeast. Tastes like lemon, yeast and spice. Light and refreshing.
Fresh and tasty aroma, citrus and a bit sour. Beautiful pale color and foam and fine lively carbonation. Great taste of wheat and light-medium bitterness.
bottle. Golden colour, fluffy-frothy head. Medium-bodied with a nice malty character and good, dry hops. Pleasantly smooth on the palate.
UPDATED: AUG 11, 2015 Clear light golden with a medium head. Light fruity aroma. Slightly bitter aftertaste. Very good balanced session beer.

Trappist monks from the Catsberg monastery in France founded the St Sixtus monastery in 1831. In 1838, brewing began at Westvleteren. 
The blonde with the green cup is probably the best beer I ever tasted. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a hazy golden body with a medium head. Nice yeasty aroma. Very nice and yeasty taste with a nice balance.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

330cc bottle. Pours pale blonde and slightly hazy with nice white foamy head. A bit of citrus, herb, yeast, wet straw, malt and biscuit. Very belgian, perfectly balanced. A great belgian blonde and strait forward brew, without complexity but very wel crafted.

Birra bionda di colore paglierino chiaro; colpisce subito il predominante ma delicatissimo profumo di fiori, avvolgente e delicato.
Schiuma persistente di media durata, gusto complesso che varia al palato e che dona un retrogusto di fiori e di limone.
Una birra di altissimo livello per veri intenditori che racchiude in se la sintesi della perfezione brassicola,

Cloudy golden, some floating sediment. Stable, rocky, white head. Fruity, malty aroma. Grain and hints of yeast. Flavour has malt, notes of banana and candy. Hints of barnyard in the long nose. Light and easily drinkable, not overly complex but well balanced. Creamy and fluffy mouthfeel with good bitter and dry bite. Good one.

Bronze body with a poofy head. Lovely aroma evinces fresh grains, accompanied by easygoing esters. The body drinks of easy, clean graininess--as if the grains are fresh off the mill. Touches of Belgian esters impart a complementary aspect and depth.
Very nice beer. Refreshing on a hot day, good taste and after taste, very smooth. A firm head that lasts. Not the best of the Westvleterens but very nice.

330ml bottle at home from trade with Erzengel, many thanks. Bottle past the BB-date. light yellow light hazy color. medium big white head. smells fruity, yeasty, acidic, light barnyard, some sweetness, honey notes, light metallic. medium body, soft carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes quite fruity, some sweetness, citric, acidic, oranges, peach, light soapy, lemongrass. finishes dry and with a nice light citric sour note. great beer, drinks very nice, I liked the taste a lot better than the smell, possibly because the beer is past its prime, but still drinks very nice and refreshing. reminds me a bit of a saison.
From zombier. In Westvleteren cup, playing Kings Bounty Dark Side. Amazing. Simply amazing

On tap at In De Vrede. Pour is golden yellow with a medium sized white head. Aroma and flavor of sweet pale malt, belgian candi sugar, citrus, banana, and cloves. Finish is slightly boozy with a nice spice and sugar backbone. Good.

Evening where we drink the 3 Westvletsren after each other. 1/3. Bottle 33cl. Hazy yellow with a white head. Aroma reminds me of a wheat beer. A bit boring taste where distant rye is present. Short finish

Honey colored pour with beautiful lasting foam head, gentle carbonation, some sediment. Aroma is well balanced, fresh, and slightly sour: fresh grain, hay, lime, lemon zest, yeast. Taste is fresh, yeasty (a bit like a Saison), grains and lemon return. Development is light bitter, lemon, slightly sour. Mouthfeel is round. Aftertaste is a bit dry and bitter.
Gulbrun klar med to fingre høyt hvitt skum. Lukter korn. noe banan og krydder. Smaker mild søtlig fruktig, banan. Svært kort lett bitter avslutning

Bottle 0.33 l, Drink Hala, Wrocław, Poland.
Złote, mętne piwo z obfitą, puszystą i trwałą pianą oraz świeżym, słodowym, owocowym, belgijskim aromatem. W smaku łagodne, orzeźwiające, lekko biszkoptowe z owocowymi nutami i łagodną goryczką na finiszu.

Aroma: Lemongrass, Wheat, Mild White Grape

Appearance: Hazy Golden Straw Hue, Passes Some Light, Mildly Thin White Head Ring, Almost No Lacing

Taste: Wheat, Lemongrass, Mild White Grape

Mouthfeel: Average Carbonation, Light to Medium Bodied, Mildly Drying
Goudgeel heerlijk doordrinkbaar bier. Lekker bitter met een hele lange afdronk. Triple-achtig. Een van de beste blondbieren.
Bottle - pours golden hazy yellow. Smells of wheat, straw, slight banana. Taste is grainy, light malt, slight peppery on the backend.

Bottle @ In De Vrede. Cloudy, golden blonde color. White head, thin layer retention throughout. Aromas: fruity, grainy, grassy, light sweet. Retronasal its moderate sweet, herbal, grassy. Flavor is light sweet, light bitter, hint of caramel. Medium bodied. Quite high carbo. Finish has some spices (aniseed?) and moderate bitterness.

Dec 22, 2006 Bottle at home. Another wonderful experience. Very light and sweet. Much less dense in flavour and texture than its darker brethren. Least favourite of the 3 Westies. But, absolutely nothing to complain about.
Biertjes gekocht in de abdij zelf. Ik vind de blonde niet niet de beste van e drie qua smaak niet speciaal wel gewoon een lekker biertje

33cl bottle at home. Clear golden with a medium white head with low retention. Light to medium body with ditto carbonation. Pretty sweet with some subtle bitter tones. Caramel, yeast, malts, citrus and herbs. An ok blond, but nothing spectacular.

One of my favorites blond beers. Westvleteren lives up to the hype, even with the blond delight. Creamy yellow body with lemon aroma and taste. Light bitterness, citrus, earthy, slightly sweet finish. Good for when youre slightly thirsty and/or with warmer weather. Still have some at home for the summer.

Bottle thanks to Dr. Owl during RBWG Lobby Share. Pours a cloudy yellow with small frothy off white head. The aroma is floral, wheat, yeast, dough. Medium mouth with nice funk, lemon, dough, light sweetness, really enjoyed this one.

The beer has a nice blond color, which is a bit cloudy. In its aroma, it combines malt, yeast and some fruit accents. These are also reappear in the taste, where the fruit accent hints at the combination of banana and citrus. The most amazing is the balance you find in this beer. Definitely a benchmark for blond abbey/trappist style beers.

Blonde beer with nice cap rich of flavour recalling honey. Amazing taste with an unbelivable balance between sweet and bitter. You cant distinguish between since its balancing its amazing. Really nice body not loosing its really easy drinkable characteristic. Amazing!

Bottle of 33cl, in a Westvleteren Trappist glass; from the fridge.

Great blond beer, but well, is not as good as the Westvleteren XII.

The aroma is great aswell as the deep blond colour. Nice taste of trappist yeast, with the usual blond taste (wheat, barley).

Go try it !
Aroma of fruits, light malt, yeast, hint of spices. Flavour is moderate sweet with a moderate bitter finish. Quite tasty Belgian Blonde.

330ml bottle, shared at La Tana (Rome). Best before 2010, what a drag it is getting old! (especially for a belgian ale). Poured a cloudy golden bright color with a medium white head. Aroma is honey, flowers, a touch of orange peel. Flavour is undefined, sweet but evanescent, some honey traces, so watery. It totally lacks its body! Just a note: This rate should not count on the overall value of this beer which remains a world class when fresh!

UPDATED: MAR 30, 2016 0,33 bottle shared by Mortlach at la Tana pub in Rome-Italy. Huge thanks Sir! Best before 2010, this beer was easily over 7-8 years old which is pretty much for a Belgian Ale. Anyway...poured a cloudy golden bright color, the white cap was amazingly all there. Nose: massive blast of honey! Yeast in the background. Mouth: thin or better invisible body, light honey sweetness. I have sipped it a lot before pouring it away. This rate should not count on the overall value of this beer which fresh stays world class!
30/03/2016 re-tested in Kosovo, bottle purchased in Rome at Johnny Off L. store. Hazy golden pour, super creamy white foam. Nose: biscuity, spicy, a bit melon and some lemon grass. Quite nice and elegant. Mouth: medium soft carbonation, grains, lemonade, a bit grassy. Just great!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Rated from beer log from 2009 Belgian Trip.... Light yellow in color, gentle hops in flavor, minimal bitterness with slight sweetness... Finish is slightly bitter, a very nice blonde...

UPDATED: DEC 9, 2016 [2/15] Bottle. Slightly hazy pale gold with a white head that lasts well. Aroma is spicy and floral with light dough, lemons. Fairly high carbonation, creamy alive texture. Not so yeasty as it smells, more hay than dough, some apricot, lovely lemon and quite punchy (but not overbearing) spices, dry at the end with moderate bitterness. Refreshing, elegant. [4]Cant read the date. Citrus sadly mostly missing, but the finish is still great: dry, bitter enough, expressive spices. [3.8] Averaging score.

UPDATED: FEB 19, 2016 Bottle 33cl traded with Olliejobbins thanks. A blond beer with good head. Nose is on almond, orange and honey. Aroma is on honey, quince, body is watery, pleasant hops bitterness, less complex.
Rerated : Shared by Bartlebier, A cloudy blond beer with low head, nose is on honey and light saison yeast. Aroma is on honey, quince, grassy hops, good bitterness, ripped fruits.

330 ml bottle. Pours a yellow/draw color with light retentive head. Aromas of apples, light peach, grain and Belgian yeast. Flavors of apples and bitter citrus, with herbal/floral notes. A very subtle and pleasant beer.
330ml bottle. Pours light gold with a medium head. Aroma is spritzy lemon, coriander and a little funky farmhouse yeast. Taste is yeasty with lemon. Light sweet peppery finish.

330ml bottle courtesy of skullgeorge. Hazy golden color with white head. Dusty malty and yeasty aroma, citrusy fruity, banana, some funky notes. Sweet and bitter taste like aroma. Medium oily body with soft to average carbonation.
Pale gold pour with a fluffy white head. Spicy, banana, lemon spritz, slightly funky aromas. Taste is yeasty banana and bubblegum, spicy, slight sourness, slight sweetness especially at the end

Bought at the Abbey, July 2014, drunk January 2015. Wonderfully floral with grassy and herbal notes. Could smell it in forever. A perfect head, as all the Westy products display. Outstanding taste, smooth and elegant, tickles the throat in a most pleasing way. Has the long finish of a fine ale. Not legendary like the Westy 8 and 12 but maybe it ought to be?

0,33l bottle, best before 3/10/2015, souvenir from my colleagues trip to Antwerp over New Years Day. Clear, pale golden yellow with a frothy, stable, white head. As good as a pale ale can look. Almost witbier-like aroma of banana, lemon, vanilla and cloves with sweetish and sourish hints in the background as in a saison. Really appetising although not that strong. Taste is full of banana and yeast with hints of cloves and lemon. Good. It starts just slightly sweet and becomes more bitter towards the finish. A slight tartness remains on the tongue. Medium body, very creamy mouthfeel, average carbonation. Decent brew although I expected way more regarding aroma and flavour. Dont get me wrong, that beer is pure quality, but it lacks some excitement. Therefore a bit disappointing.

UPDATED: NOV 20, 2015 Lovely hazy translucent straw yellow. With a thin clean generous white foam head. 

The nose shows a lot of lemon zest. 

Lovely foamy body with a round malt/bready sweetness. Begins and ends on the sweetness. Its very mild - just enough to know its there. The mid palate also shows a hint of sourness. Reminds of a good German lager with a good nose and a tinge of sourness on the palate.
Excellent blonde. Honey sweet little tart, good balance. But Not special for me.

The green cap in the holy Westvleteren Trinity, replacing the old red cap dubbel since 1998. Hazy peach blonde beer with a thick, rocky, yellowish white, very stable head, clearly hops-enhanced; yeasty and dryishly malty aroma, grassy and leafy hops, orange peel, white pepper, bitter honey, peach, dough, hint of banana but also a faint presence of cooked cabbage; fruity onset, in a dryish way, pale malt sweetness, a bit grainy, sourish and spicy yeasty hints, smooth, evolving into a leafy and grassy hop bitter and yeasty finish. Used to be one of the top Belgian blond ales, with a crisp, green, utterly refreshing and quenching hoppiness, but more recent tastings I did appeared less hoppy and more balanced towards the malts. Still a very genuine and honest beer though, of course on a totally different level compared with its dark brethren, but very enjoyable. Does not age well though: the fresher you can taste this, the better, with a young sample from tap at De Vrede at the top end of the scale.

Bottle thanks to bytemesis (I think). Nose is honey with a pils malt crackery aroma, light peppery hops noted. Pour is fairly clear with a small white head that leaves layer of film on top of the beer. Taste is mostly honey with a faint pils malt flavor, low bitterness. Slightly watery and a touch of oxidation (my fault for not drinking this immediately). Overall, pretty solid, but nothing mind blowing.
@ in de Vrede, Westvleteren. Blond van kleur, mooie crêmige kraag. Ruikt niet heel sterk, mout, hoppig, gist. Idem smaak, subtiel met redelijk wat body. Onopvallend goed.

Tht okt 2015 op 6°C. Zeer subtiele aroma's van gist/deeg en kruiden. Lichtgeel, lichttroebel met wit schuim dat zakt tot een halve centimeter. Smaken van tarwe, gist en iets fruitigs op de achtergrond. Olieachtig mondgevoel, koolzuur medium. Licht bittere medium lange afdronk. Perfect uitgebalanceerd licht bier.

Bottle at home courtesy of hackobock, cheers Jacob
Hazy blonde with pillowy foamy white head. Dusty hessian and grainy nose. Lively carbonation, full bodied, malt and fruity yeast esters. Very easy drinking, wheaty creaminess, spice delicious.

Christmas beer 7. My second westy from harrisoni, saved for today after meeting in brum. Cheers Ian. Golden beer with medium head and stratified lacing. There is a big chunnel of bubbles coming from the middle of the glass. Aroma is bready, lemon, citrus and yeast. Taste is bread, yeast, lemon and a little dry breadiness. Medium carbonstion, soft on the mouth. Excellent.
user_location: West Bromwich (Yorkshire Expat), West Midlands, ENGLAND

text: Bottle 0.33l at home, Nivala. 2014 vintage. Colour is very cloudy golden with small thick white head. Aromas and flavors: Sweetness, some honey, fruits, citrus, hints of spices, Belgian yeast and malts. Nice fruity Belgian ale.

Bottle 0.33L.
Cloudy golden body with an average, creamy, white head, fully lasting with very nice lacing; some lees are evident.
Complex aroma: moderate malty (cereals) and hoppy (citrus, flowers) and light yeasty (cardboard) with notes of spices (cloves) and fruits.
Flavour is mainly acidic and sweet with some bitterness in the finish.
Light-to-medium body with watery-to-oily texture; average carbonation; some astringency in the finish.
Na de westvleteren 8 en 12 een wat gewoon biertje wat bijna smaakt als een gewone pils al heeft deze uiteraard wel wat meer bite.

hazy,murky yellow with a thin head. Very floral, hoppy aroma. Taste was slightly sweet with a very bitter finish - but very hoppy throughout. This is one fine beer - packs in a lot of hoppy flavor. To me it looked like a clone of Duvel. Reminded me so much of Duvel. Like Duvel - this is highly drinkable and likeable and can grow on you.
A: Dadels, apricot T: Dadels as well. Dried fruits all the way. O: Very nice beer! I've had the other Westvleteren so this is very different. Much more like a lager.

0.33l bottle. Hazy deep golden body, white head. Aroma of hay, grass, cheese, biscuit and some candi sugar like sweetness. The taste is similar to the aroma. It has notes of biscuit, bread, grassy hops and some yeast. Very nice beer.

33 cl. thanks Gem! Pours a foggy, straw-golden with some floaties and a billowing head of meringue that takes a while to subside. Aroma of spicy toast, earthy honey, roasted maize and touches of orange and evergreen resin. Flavors of honey, toasted maize, earthy bread, peaches and a bit of resiny herb. Hints of peppery dry grass. Seems like some roasted malt that adds a little flavor of dry cocoa and bitter nut on the long finish. Balanced, near-medium body has a soft carbonation and a light astringency to help sweep the big maltiness away. Really shifted to pretty dry by the end of the bottle. It took a few sips to warm up to the upfront honey and maize-like flavors in this one, but after the other flavors came out I was ready to chug it. Very nice "basic beer" that has much more complexity than most.

Bottle: Dense, vibrant, & opaque. Radiant golden-amber with a rocky, chunky, porous cream head that lasts for a great long while before deciding to reduce. Grassy & herbal aroma, lemon zest, mineral water, white pepper, a hint of apricot, & classic Belgian yeast giving off implied notes of cardamom & clove. Underbody of freshly baked bread & milled cereal grains. Very nice. Flavor follows the same path but is slightly more understated. Zesty herbal grass, moderate floral notes, lemon zest, mild peppery phenolic spices, gummy yeast, slightly fruity esters, & a timid, earthy bitterness in the finish. Just a hint of seemingly metallic astringency hits on the very back-end, but it doesnt ruin the experience. Kind of a minor nuisance. Bone dry finish; herbal hay remnants left behind. A scrumptious Belgian ale. The flavor didnt deliver quite like the nose, but still pretty good overall.
0,33l bottle @ One Pint Pub. Pours cloudy yellow with a high head. Aroma is malts and yeast. Flavor is malts, yeast and hops. Decent, but a bit disappointing.
Kuuteen lasiin jaettu pullo@ OPP. Sameahko ja sakkainen. Tuoksussa hiivaa, vehnää, käynyttä hedelmää. Maussa vehnää, mallasta, hiivaa, vähän banaania, kukkaisuutta.

UPDATED: DEC 15, 2014 330ml poured in a Westvleteren chalice.
A: Pours a very cloudy beige color forming a big white head which dissipates reasonably fast but not totally leaving alot of lacings. Also many particles can be seen floating around
S: The first thing to hit the nose is bread. Very bready and also yeasty. Followed by fruits, mainly pears and figs. Journey continues with the flowery and earthy hops in the end. Bit of alcohol. Great
T: Bready. Sweet malts, fruits and yeasts, mainly. Dry in the mouth with a delicate but stingy bitterness in the end. Simple and delicious
O: Light to medium body. Medium carbonation. Dry upfront and grassy hoppy aftertaste. Well, not much more to say about a beer produced by one of the best brewers in the world
[ BA Review @ 12/29/2011 ]

Bottle. Pours golden with some residue and a big creamy head. Aroma is very Belgian with fruity spicy yeast and sweet kandi notes. Full body with average carbonation. Flavour is tart with fruity yeast, spice, orange peel and kandi. Finishes with a long tart and fruity yeast, bordering farmhouse.
Bottle at Craigs. Pours golden amber, nose is floral, lemon, taste is dry, light fruit.
Bottle. Dirty brownish pour with a frothy tan head. Lots of yeasty notes, some herbs, vanilla, figs, raisins and caramel.

Bottle 0.33l, taste 0.2l at Belgian Beer Weekend in Grand Place Brussels Belgium.Pour it clear yellow color with small white head.Taste and aroma of citrus, wheat, spices and Belgian yeast.I really expected more.Nice and good balanced of sweetness and bitterness.
On tap at Westvlereren; nice beer .. quite easy drinking for smooth for its beet type. Not as good as the 8 or 12, but a nice beer none the less. I would buy this again for sure

Thanks to Ezrangel for this. Pours cloudy yellow gold with a frothy white top and great lacing. Aroma is grains, straw and biscuit. Taste is light and fruity, a small peppery, biscuit finish. Just clean and refreshing.

Fresh bottle poured at Kulminator in Antwerp. Pours hazy yellow with lots of yeasties floating around and a fluffy white head on top. Aroma of straw and hops, plenty of yeast and light fruits. Flavor is slightly dry, with apples and pears pairing with straw, a bit of sweetness balanced with hop bite, tripel funk, and some other yeast spice. Light bodied, medium plus carbonation. Really nice brew and glad I have some bottles to take home.

20.10.10 on the green capsule. Brewed in october 2009, in human language. Subtract 1 year for the blonde, 3 years for the 8 and 12 to know the batch time. This is a 5 year old bottle. 

Pours a golden hazy yellow and cloudy when chilled. Amazing foam head on every pour. Explosion of aromas and mellow hops (styrian goldings, northern brewer, halertau ?+!). Lemon, orange peel, white came sugar, coriander, verbena, a hint of cork far away in the nose... and a mild acidity. Pils and pale ale malt comes to mind. One of the best blonde beers around that offer a strong body compared to the low % vol. Yummy

From a belgian bottle! Pours a cloudy golden yellow and makes a medium frothy white head smells like a typical belgian white, citrus, light hops and a bit of yeast. Tastes like wheat and lemon. Light and refreshing. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Had this several times, but the best is still fresh @ De Vrede. Hazy (light) golden beer with a good white head. Fresh herbal hoppy aroma (a little citrus), with some creamy vanilla notes (yeast). Nice bitter and crisp taste, but not vicious hoppy. Refreshing and for me the best Westvleteren.
Pours with a thick foam head, lively carbonation. Belgian yeast and grassy aroma, light but balanced flavour, with quite a thick mouthfeel .

Bottle 0,33l. Pourd a hazy yellow coloured beer with a thick white head. Aroma of light yeast and hop aroma, some spice, pear and tropical fruit. A spicy, yeasty taste, loads of fruit and spice and malt. The finish has a mild tartness. Dry mouthfeel.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Very hazy blonde pour with a small white head. Spicy yeast and malt aromas. Flavor is dry with slight yeast funky.m
 Mildly bitter and dry finish. Very refreshing.
At the source. Clear blonde, small white head. Nice belgian blonde. Spicy yeast, dry and bitter finish. Good.
Pours a hazy yellow with long lasting white head. I like how one of the other users put it, "Nice, but not world changing"
Hazy yellow colour, white foam. Medium carbonation. Light malty aroma with notes of grasses, light citrussy. Hoppy with bitter and dry finish. Easy drinkable. Very good Belgian ale.

Bottle:
Slightly hazy gold with a quick white head.
Bubbly...particulates.
Pear and apple aroma.
Tingly, sweet white fruit taste.
Very light and breathy.
Delicate.

Enjoyed at In de Vrede. Pours a hazy bright yellow colour with a frothy/creamy white head that dissipates. Aroma is of banana, citrus fruit, esters, and spice. Taste is a little bitter in the finish but not really sweet, quite nice. Lighter body, thinner mouth feel and softer carbonation. Great blonde, really enjoyable.

Flaske delt med importør og skibsrederen, juli-14: højt skum som daler høflig til gardinformat. Snill aroma av citrus, litt sukker og belgisk gjær (og krydderet fra den). Fin munnfylde med citrustoner som akkompagnerer krydder og humle på en meget balansert måte. Men jeg skjønner ikke all den uforbeholdne jubelen omkring denne, der finnes mange belgiske øl som gir like stor drikkeopplevelse.

Pale golden. Dense and persistent white head and lacing. Aroma of Czech pilsner hops, white candy sugar, grass and hay. Similar taste. Well-balanced with high drinkability. Very good, but not spectacular

UPDATED: SEP 14, 2014 One of the best beers ever made. Ive to drive 350km for this beer, but still love it. 

---

Blijft een geweldig biertje. Bestel hem standaard als ik naar Westvleteren rijd om bier te gaan halen. Telkens een rit van 2x170 kilometer, toch elke keer geweldig als daar zon heerlijk blond westvleteren op je staat te wachten. Heb er inmiddels thuis ook enkele bakken van staan, super om na een dag studeren dit biertje te kunnen drinken in de warme zomermaanden.

Uiteindelijk kost een krat van dit heerlijk bier 30euro, wat goedkoper is als een bak westmalle tripel, maar stuk duurder dan bvb een bak westmalle extra. Persoonlijk vind ik hem qua smaak hier ergens tussen inzitten. Ook al valt een tripel niet echt te vergelijken met dit, anderzijds zou een tafelbier zoals de extra nooit op een lijn durven te zetten met deze. Het zal toch een beetje de mythe rond de blonde westvleteren zijn die er mij toe aanzet geregeld naar ginder te rijden om enkele van deze bakken op te halen.

Nevelig, geelblond bier met wat zwevende gist die met uitschenken is meegekomen. Stevige witte schuimkraag. Aroma is hop, gist, licht citrus, hars. Fris, bitter met een lichte zoete noot. Fijn, zacht palet. Flinke body voor een bier met een vrij laag alcoholpercentage.

A hazy yellow coloured beer with a thick white head. A light yeast and hop aroma, some spice, pear drops and tropical fruit. Dry mouthfeel. A spicy, yeasty taste, loads of fruit and spice, and a background maltiness. The finish has a mild tartness. Tasted at "In de Vrede", Westvleteren.

Pours a dark amber colour, and some persistent head. Aroma is more of herbal hops with yeast. Very little texture. Taste is a little hoppy, and the bitterness actually hits you back in the aftertaste.

It was about half a year before I had this beer, along with the other two top beers from Westvleteren. I was so drunk that night and couldnt recall any clue of this rare beer. Maybe it is not very special? I have to taste again some time. Hope soon.

Bottle from Bier Tempel. Yellowish gold, hazy, white head, high carbonation. Quite a hoppy blonde, some slightly spicy and earthy hop with a tiny hint of citrus and a strong yeasty funk. Extremely drinkable, crazy monks with their 6% session beers! Nice but not world changing.

Bottle--a stunner of a find at Delerium Cafe in Rio de Janeiro! Bright yellow, lively white head of fine bubbles, excellent retention. Very delicate florals, highly fragrant, austere malts. Deeply complex for such a light beer. I enjoyed this better than the 12.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text:
Bona cervesa, equilibrada i gustosa.
Buena cerveza, equilibrada y sabrosa.

Aroma is very fruity with lots of tropical fruit, pineapple and melon. Medium light pink and white peppercorn phenolic notes with very faint coriander notes. A very light, sweet graininess. Some stone fruit notes of pear and peaches. 
Pours a fairly cloudy, pale, golden, hay color with a large, pillowy, white head with never ending head retention. Moderately high lacing and faint legs. 
Flavor has a light, sweet graininess with moderate peppercorn phenolic notes. Light coriander character. Light tropical fruit notes with some faint stone fruit character. Faint bitterness. Pineapple, peach and pear. 
Mouthfeel is light bodied with medium carbonation. Low astringency and low alcohol warmth. 
Overall a delicious beer with a really nice tropical and stone fruit character. Well balanced, clean phenolic notes really balance out the fruit. Very enjoyable, refreshing beer.
Troebele oranjegouden kleur met een volle kraag. Ruikt fruitig, hop,kruiden, subtiel. Beetje zoetig. Smaakt fruitig, banaan, bitter, iets zoetig vanilleachtig. Licht bittere afdronk.
(bottle) cloudy pale yellow colour with a small white head; aroma starts with lambic like sourness, then cloves, then hint of flowers; clean and dry flavour with a long light bitter finish

Clean dandelion hue; white bread, lavender, cardamom and white wine vinegar in a deep and intricate aroma.
Similar flavor; soda cracker, pear flesh, minerals, and apricot skin; some citrus pith suggests hops teasingly.
A crackling surface of lively carbonation gives way to a body that manages both depth and refreshment, not surprisingly in the least.

aroma is nice and wierd. Some lambic sort of sourness with softer notes and wheat. clody yellow beer with white head. taste is light with some bitterness. Maybe the edge has disappeared in this beer. enjoyable but not greatness

bbe in 6 months.
Bottle from bier tempel, brussels. Hazy yellow color, white head. Nice aroma of wheat, citrus notes, some yeast and sour notes. Wheaty aroma, lemon, yeast, sour notes.
Heerlijk blond bier met een fruitige nasmaak. Helaas ook hier dat de beschikbaarheid te laag is.

Aroma: honey, caramel malts. Appearance: hazy pale gold, medium frothy head. Taste: light bitter. Palate: bitters intensify, getting very dry, Overall: nice Belgian Ale, lovely honey in the aroma. Pint at In de Vrede, Westvleteren.
Smell of malt. Muddy amber colour, white high head. Aroma of hops, citrus, orange peel, some spruce. A bit like gose or IPA. Medium sour.

Bottle at in de verde

A - pours a hazy golden straw color with a 1.5 finger eggshell head that leaves lots of foamy lacing on the way down.

S- wheat, straw, faint hints of light fruit

T- yeasty, peach, large wheat presence finished out with a light hop bitterness.

M- medium/light bodied and effervescent

D- subtle, easy to drink, not at all overbearing. A great blonde.
Bottle @In de vrede. Pours cloudy golden with white adhesive head. Aroma is intense yeasty, fruity. Taste is yeasty, fruity. Light bitterness in the finish. OK, but nothing more.

Bottle @ Bjarnes. Pours slightly hazy light golden with a white head, lacings. Aroma of malt, yeast, honey, flowers, honey, slight oxidation. Flavor is malt, yeast, light brett notes, light oxoidation, flowers, honey. Medium body, average carbonation. 100514

33cl bottle served in a Delirium Tremens Glass. Pours a pale blonde colour with quite good carbonation. Aroma and taste to me seems a little underwhelming with no particular highlights. Quite flowery and nicely balanced but there are far better blondes available at a far more reasonable cost (in the UK). Would rather have Kasteel or Maredsous.

Bottle from trade, thanks Mathieu! Pours cloudy yellow gold with a clingy white head. Aroma of yeast, wheat, banana and spice. Flavor follows nose, plenty of yeast with a bit of spice in the finish. Nicely balanced.

Big white head, pale yellow hazy color. Refreshing, yeast, grass, sugar, a bit funky. Hints of spice, especially clove. Sweet, refreshing, hay and yeast adding up well with the spices, hints of honey. Very well balanced, perfect fitting carbonation, which leads to a smooth, fresh mouthfeel. Clove is big in this, without being too present on the tastebuds. Results in a warm, yeast supportedpleasant finish.
Dark fruits on the nose. Quite sweet tasting, typical yeast flavours and some spice. Enjoyed it, was easy to drink and flavoursome.
Another great westy beer. Bready, biscuit heavy, with some appa joose, grass, and white bread. Lightly sweet with some light noble hop bite. Good beer.

Bottle. Hazy copper color with a medium thick head. Some lacing. Medium aroma of apricot and ripe mandarin with notes of yeast and wheat. Medium dry taste with some sourness. Some bitterness in finish. Medium body. Balanced package.
Bue en bouteille de 33cl. Belle couleur blonde. Bière pas trop typée belge. Houblons bien équilibrés mais pas assez de corps à mon goût.
Bu en bouteille de 33cl, une couleur blonde très chouette et une mousse intense, petite odeur de fer (capsule ?) au nez, puis attaque en bouche sur le houblon noble, décevant

A little old bottle. Stumble upon it in the summer of 2013. Bottle reads 13.09.13 and this is the best before date i thinck. Im guessing it was bottled a year before. Clear yellow nice looking color. Taste of yeast and spices. Must try this one more time fresh.
Beste blonde bier dat ik ooit geprobeerd heb. Echt een aanrader. Moet niet onderdoen voor de 12

Bottle cap numbers 21.03.14 graciously sent along in trade from Orson0368! Great excuse to break out the trappist glass!
