Pour has a wheat color with a thick coating of off white head that settled down to a pillow on the surface. Aroma has pale malts, mild sweet fruit, Belgian yeast, and a hint of spices. Mouth feel is light and there is plenty of carbonation. Flavor Has a very light pale malt, trappist yeast, mild herbal hops, and grains. The beer is gentle overall but has all the characteristics of a well made trappist beer. Dialed right down to a super session level.
Golden color, hazy, generous white head (fine foam), aroma of malt and hops, medium bodied. It starts with malt. Then, the hops and the bitterness appears. Longish bitter finish.
Apple juice and malts on the aroma, sweet fruity Belgian esters very complex and moderately sweet. Balanced finish

Blonde dorée trouble-opaque, sédiments en suspension, effervescence moyenne, col blanc fin. Plutôt maltée en entrée, son amertume houblonnée se dévoile tout en douceur avec du zeste de citron et quelques notes de bananes. Supérieure mais tout de même surestimée...
Bottle from Beer Mania. A though beer, not too much to pick up on, if you dig hard you get some dough, wheat, solvent, grass, dandelion and detergent.

Hazy yellow in color, one of the best Belgium blondes I have ever had looking forward to the 8 and 12.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle. Yellow colour, very hazy with yeasts sediment. Frothy texture head. Aroma is typical for Belgian wits - spices, citrus, wheat and yeasts. Full body, very refreshing. It reminds me witbier, lot of fruits, wheat, gently hops, yeasty. Perfect balanced! Exceptional!
Typical Belgian spicy aroma. Cloudy caramel color. Really well balanced. Lots of taste. One of the best blonds I have tasted.
Ins Glas ergießt sich ein leicht trübes goldenes Bier mit ordentlicher Schaumkrone. Geruch hefig, malzig süß, leicht würzig. Geschmack leicht hefig, fruchtig malzig, Gewürze, blumig.

Less special then the '12.
As a blond it's not bad but I've tasted better ones. But still in my top 3 blond beers.
Still a soft taste for the tongue and pours gold with a white head which doesn't stays that long.
Nice herb taste which stays long in your mouth.
@ Havregatan. Flaska från Mikkeller Bottle Shop, Köpenhamn (100 DKK). Fruktig och frisk, syrlig och torr, jäst, örter, något tunn i smaken. Avslutningen är lång, torr och ganska besk.
Bottle pour light yellow with big head. Aroma is Belgian esters and piney hops. Taste is crisp and clean with a light bitter finish

330ml bottle. Hazy golden colour, frothy white foam head that leaves lots of lacing and aroma of spice, lemon, banana, yeast. Taste is peppery earthy, citrus rind, spice, yeasty with slight fruity floral, lingering bitterness. Smooth mouthfeel, medium bodied, soft to medium carbonation, drying bitter finish.

Appearance- golden, hazy, rising bubbles, a bit of sediment floating around, half a finger of a white head which persists. Aromas of biscuit, hay/straw notes, spice, caramel, citrus. Taste- smooth, creamy, hints of lemon and zest, some banana, hops, little bitterness, very easy drinking. A nice balance.
I didnt really like belgian beers till I tasted this blond trappist, perfectly balanced, delicious.

330ml bottle, poured into a Westvleteren Trappist glass. Appearance is cloudy straw colored with floaties and large foamy white head, that reduced quickly but left a lasting thin layer. Aroma of herbs, lemon peels, banana, pears and a hint of dried apricots. Flavours of lemon peels, herbs, wheat bread, spices and a hint of banana and pears. Taste is light sweet and light bitter. Westvleterens blond is the most flavourful, full bodied, strongest and spiciest Trappist Patersbier I have tasted. This would be a beer I would drink regularly if it werent expensive and restricted in availability.
Bottle. Hazy golden with white head. Spicy peppery yeast aroma, little banana. Similar taste, dusty and peppery. Medium body with a clean finish. Decent but not very exciting.

Bottle from Vika enjoyed at home
Pours golden, big creamy white head. Smells of honey, yeast esters, hints of spices, malts and fruityness. Moderate sweet, a touch of honey, light malts, fruity yeast flavors, spices, quite vinous for a blonde, just very nice. Modererate bitter finish, nice and spicy. World class belgian blonde

Bottle thanks to Bob! Pours a near clear pale gold with a white head that lasts throughout the beer. Aroma has a nice grassiness with some light fruits, a touch of sweetness and some yeast. Flavor has a great combination of grass and light sweet grains with a touch of sweet fruits and Belgian yeast.
Aparte bijsmaak die niet is thuis te brengen. Deze Westvleteren is zeker niet mijn favoriet. Vered een standaard bier weinig boeiend.

0.33 bottle. Yellow in color with a sort of yeasty suspension and a white head. Aroma of yeasts, honey, spices and some Belgian hops and barnyard scents. Taste is rather delicate, sweet and sour with nice hop bitterness. Medium body, smooth texture, and soft carbonation. Finish is a little citric and good as well with the same, delicate, hop bitterness. Overall the beer is great, nicely balanced, and moderated.

Thanks Mike. Pours a cloudy pale yellow. Aroma- lots of citrus, dust, pine, and slight funk. Nice hop aroma. Palate is lovely it has a real softness to it that makes it very easy to drink. Flavours are nuanced of earthy citrus and hints of spice that are really well balanced with the late woody hoppiness. Taste is beautiful hop bitterness, crisp, clean, dry and wonderful funk on the back of the tongue. Awesome.

BOTTLE 33CL.

Look: dirty amber-beige and murky with a white medium frothy head with an average retention. 
Aroma: light fruity, citrus, herbal and spicy.
Taste: spicy herbs, medium spicy bitterness. Almost flat carbonation.

Bottle @ home. Schiuma bianca abbastanza fine poco persistente. Birra ambrata velata con riflessi dorati. Aroma fruttato, agrumato agrumato discorza darancia. Lievito belga, zucchero candito, speziata di coriandolo.gusto dolce abboccato, quasi secca, amara erbacea, speziata di coriandolo un poco di mais cotto. Corposa,carbonata , poco calda, non molto rotonda ma estremamente equilibrata. Armonica e di facilissima beva.
Yellow clouty with nice white head. Tablecloth with little malt in the aroma. Thick malt, catpiss and fruites with a bitter aftertaste. Medium body and carbon.

Finally tasted at Hemelrijk in Hasselt.
I thought would be better.
I prefer the XII...
hazy blond with suspencious, white head
refreshing zesty with an incredible mouthfull finish

UPDATED: JUL 27, 2014 Temporary rating. At some point I might re-write this.

Hazy golden, huge creamy frothy white head, slow diss, soapy lacing.
Phenolic, crackers, bakers yeast, lemon zest, green grapes, plums, hay, dry soil, white pepper corns, tiny bandaids, tiny leather, 
Tiny sour, slightly bitter, phenolic, crackers, lemon zest, grapefruit rinds, grape skins, unripe plums, white pepper corns, leather, dry soil, moist hay, tiny bandaid, tiny unripe pear,
Crisp, dry, tiny tart, tiny watery, soft, light.
Bitter, phenolic, crackers, hay, unripe plums, unripe pears, lemon zest, hay, dry soil, grape skins, leather, tiny bandaid,
One of the most drinkable beers Ive tried. It was gone in minutes. Their best offering.

(Bottle, 08. 08. 14) Pours in orange to pale body with heavy, long lasting foam. Aroma is yeasty upfront with light citrus aroma. The taste is low on sweetness, fruit notes with high spicy bitterness in the background. Palette is very well balanced. Body is medium with high carbonation.

Lively carbonated to a very pretty white, delicate head over a pale golden colour. Aroma with good intensity has breads and cerals in a hoppy herbaceous and herbal cloak, with faint pleasant fruit. Hops bitterness exceeds the remote barnyard fruity malt on palate a bit too much for me, the sweet and sour too much in the background, but a lasting grassy bitter holds a long amusing finish.

MHD: 18.06.11 
Bananig-gelb im Glas, toller frischer Geruch nach Banane, Hefe und frischem Hopfen. 
Der Antrunk ist CO²-reich, voluminös-vollmundig, und wie der Geruch verspricht hefig-bananig-mild. Sehr angenehm mild. Dazu kommt ein schönes frisches Hopfenaroma, das sich im Hauptteil noch weiter verstärkt. Dort macht sich dann auch eine moderate Herbe breit, die sehr gut zu dem süßlich-bananig-hefigen Grundcharakter des Bieres passt und zum Ende hin erstaunlich deutlich ausfällt ohne jedoch zu stumpf-herb zu wirken. 
Das Bier gibt sich blumig-herb auf der Zunge, im Nachgeschmack domoniert die blumig-aromatische Herbe zusammen mit der hefig-milden Süße. 
--> ein sehr leckeres blondes Trappistenbier. Schmeckt voller und mir daher besser als das vergleichbare, aber um 1% «schwächere» Westmalle Extra.


Test vom 17.1.2011, Gebinde: Glasflasche	Noten: 12,13,13,13,13,14 - 13,30

Purchased and consumed in brussels. 
Bottle date: 19.10.11

A: pours a golden ale with near brilliant clarity. Single finger of creamy foam falls to a thick quilt of the same which wraps the entire course of the drink. Cobweb lacing. 

S: grain, yeast, sweet Belgian sugar, rice, some really nice floral tones. I like. 

T: more bitter than anticipated. Very clean, fresh grain flavors. A hint of peppercorn on the finish for me. Like a tea, quite refreshing. 

M: spot on creamy feel with light body and slick finish. 

O: I really think this might be my favorite westy. Really simple, strait forwardly crafted beer with high quality and with hi drinkability. Now if only they increased their market...

Serving type: bottle

06-22-2011
Botella del año 2009. De apariencia muy carbonatada pero en paladar nada. Ligeramente achampanada, levaduras, seca y dulce. Pan frutos secos. Final corto seco

330ml bottle from Les Crepes de Sophie, Shrewsbury. Light, fresh & full-flavoured Blond, a touch of spiciness and a squeaze of juicy lemon zest. Nothing spectacular compared to 12 of course, but a lovely refreshing beer nonetheless.

Bottle to celebrate my rating #2000 :-) Pours clear pale straw with airy white head. Clear aroma of fruit, with notes of hops and touches of citrus. Dusty flavour with bitter, hoppy notes, a proper amount of yeast, and a touch of spices. Bitter aftertaste. A really good Belgian Ale. Again, thanks to everyone who has contributed to me reaching this far, especially my dear old Mum and MiP. Cheers! :-)
Aroma a caramelo. Apariencia rubia sin poco color. Sabor balanceado muy dulce. Cerveza parecida a la st bernardus tripel

Aroma muy parecido a la st bernardus tripel, apariencia clara sin mucha consistencia, sabor de la tripel un poco mas amarga al final, deja en el paladar el sabor a alcohol.
Para ser una rubia es muy buena cerveza.

UPDATED: OCT 29, 2016 9/12/2013 Bottle shared with harrisoni in the Westvleteren Cafe. Wow, what a beer. So Ian built this one up for me as an amazing beer and to be honest I was sceptical about a Belgian blond. However it is a revelation and took some of the shine off my crates of Westy 12, as I suddenly wanted some of this to take home too. Gives me something to look forward to next time. Very bright amber and fresh looking beer. Up close theres tiny specks of grain in the hazy beer. Bright head is medium to full, and fluffy and light. Nose is a big burst of fresh citrousy lemony hops, with citrous acidic, pithy lemon and satsuma, crisp yeast. Taste is a big burst of lemony hops, crisp Belgian yeast. Its light, effervescent and leaves a tingling lemon citrous bitterness on the tongue well after sipping. Lovely finish. Theres also a little bit of lemon curd creaminess to it. Light as a feather and bursting with citrousy hop. This is a great beer and probably the best Belgian blonde beer Ive had by a long way. Re-rate - bottle at home. Clear golden blonde beer with a thin white head. Has bubbles and floaty bits in it. Nose is stunning. Perfumed, rich cereal grains, fresh cut straw, tangerine fruit, peach and apricot, slight farmyard, tropical fruit. Taste is a big wave of summer. Fresh cereal grains, straw, grass, farmyard , honey mead, acidic green hop, grapefruit and lemon rind. such a delicate beer. Rating shifts up from 4.6 to 4.7.
En hel del jäst i aromen, lite unken också kanske. Väldigt lätt i kroppen ingen direkt styrka i varje arom eller smak. En sjuk Hype helt enkelt.
Citrusy and funky aroma. The taste is complex and similar to the aroma. Not my type of beer i am afraid.

Bière blonde orangée trouble. Peu de mousse. Odeur de céréale (froment), un peu de levure. Attaque un peu amère. Gout subtil de céréales, houblons, un peu de citron, assez pétillante. Très rafraichissante, ressemble un peu à une saison. Bonne bière mais rien de très remarquable.
Gröna korken. Mycket bra, en riktigt trevlig vardagsöl som har bra smak och härlig arom.

330 ml bottle (green cap), at Amundsen, Oslo. ABV is 5.8%. Served in a Chimay chalice. Golden colour, large white head. Pleasant spicy / peppery aroma, also notes of yeast and white kandij sugar syrup. High level of carbonation. The flavour is fairly dry and crisp, peppery with fairly bitter hops in the finish.
Bottle. Pours hazy golden/yellow with a white head. Aroma holds spices, citrus, hay. Crisp, light bitter with a medium grain sweetness. Dry spicy finish. Medium bodied.

Bottle - thanks MrH! Pours hazy golden with a small white head and nice lacing. Aroma is straw and caramel, a bit of floral as well. Flavor is light sweet, grassy, touch of yeastiness. Medium body. Nice, nothing special.
Hazy yellow, bubbly, nice foam and lacing. Aroma is fresh straw like the farm. A little dry, a little sweet, like the aroma but more "flowery". Love it.

On bottle from Vinmonopolet vika , Oslo. Golden hazy color, some sediments - good foam & sodt carbonation. Fruity and floral aromas: medium intensity- also honey and Nice yeast influence- very good aroma composition and balance. Medium body & complexity. Very well balanced. Very enjoyable

UPDATED: NOV 15, 2013 Bottle at de vrede. Pours hazy pale yellow with white head. Aroma is yeasty, dry, hops. Taste is low sweetness, medium bitter, dry and hoppy. Refreshing but still with a twist. Really good blonde beer.

Pours hazy wheat colored, big white head. 

Smells like a belgian blond, banana, gum, clove, belgian yeast sweetness.

Taste fruity, almost tangy, same tastes as the smell and a bit hoppy even, spices.

Light bodied.

Very nice beer

UPDATED: MAR 23, 2014 Citrus yellow color, hazy, moderate white foam; citrus aroma; lightly bitter and sweet, very slightly sour; light body, thin feel, crisp, refreshing, average(+) carbonation, long sweet citrus finish;
Overall: very refreshing, very high drinkability, very good taste, just great beer

Blond, mat, zeer mooie volle schuimkraag. Neus: zeer grassy, klein beetje een hint van de gist en wat frutigheid. Afdronk: bitter, droog, hops, grassy. Nasmaak droog en bitter, maar vrij kort. Lekkere, frisse door drinker.
golden, hazy, minimal head, white foam, cereal, floral, leaves, medium sweetness, medium bitterness, medium body, creamy, lively, bitter,
golden, cloudy, white foam, herbs, hay, bread, grass, medium body, sticky, average carbonation, bitter, medium sweetness, medium bitterness,

UPDATED: OCT 27, 2013 Color: nice clear blond beer with medium carbonation and big light white foam. Smell: good malt smell, with a woody nose and floral presence. Taste: good malt taste with nice bitterness. Aftertaste: great equilibrium on mouth between malt and bitterness, some alcohol taste but not unpleasant.

bleek geel/gouden troebel met schuimige witte kraag
aroma: moutig, citrus, stro, witbieraroma (tarwe), 
smaken: matig zoet, redelijk bitter, matig fruitig, redelijk moutig, redelijk kruidig, citrus, hooi, waterige body, veel te overheersende bitterheid, Belgische gist, afdronk hoppig. lichte body.
valt mij erg tegen !
Great looking and tasting Belgian blond beer. Unlike its bigger brothers, this one is blond colored. Very refreshing and wonderful creamy head. Cheers

Gold, opaltrüb, schönes hefiges und fruchtiges aroma, geschmack gleich wie aroma, sehr gut trinkbares bier und super ausgewogen

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pienikuplainen minimaalinen vaahtokukka. Samea vaalea väri. Tuoksussa heinää, syksyn lehtiä ja korianteria. Raikas monipuolinen maku jossa hienoista inkivääriä. Ei kuitenkaan oma lemppari Westyistä, mutta silti ehkä yksi parhaista kesäjuomista.

33cl into proper chalice

Westvleteren, Belgium

Appearance: golden hazy liquid with a crown of white frothy head. The whole glass is coated in lacing as I drink. 

Aroma: Yeasty, fruit, cellar notes, some small citrus. 

Taste: On the sweeter side, but not too much. Some bitterness as well. 

Palate: Fullish body, frothy texture, lively, not - but not too much carbonation. 

Overall: Pretty impressive what theyve accomplished with this beer, especially given the lower alcohol content. Its fairly dynamic, I enjoyed this with the cheese and bread available at the cafe. really nice.
Light unclear blone, thin stable foam. Aroma of Citrus, lots of cellar, yeast and floral. Taste of hay, citrus, dry, green apple and a nice balanced maltyness. Blindtaste. Decent blonde this.
Very delicious fruity and enjoyable. lots of yeast in the bottom. hazy yellow colour. White head.
Det här var riktigt gott, ölen var galet välbalanserad med en något tunn kropp. Smaken bar toner av jäst, honung, banan och krydda.
Shared a bottle at Cafe Buitenlust Oirschot. Yellow golden color, medium sized white head. Malts, some yeast, a bit fruity.

Bottle. Pours a goldy straw colour with a chunky white head. Aroma is mild yeastiness, some lemon, some orange. Light body, foamy. Yeah, just so drinkable. Orange, a little maltiness, a hint of spice... Its light, crisp, well balanced and so moreish. Lovely.
Smak och doft av jäst, humle, hö, citron och citrus. Sträv, murrig, torr, lätt kropp med en lite pepprig eftersmak. Inte helt färsk humle då det var en utgången flask men väldigt god ändå.

Taster from bottle @ BBW 2013
Aroma is straw, hay, dried grass, hops.
Hazy blond, white lacing head.
Taste has some floral and straw, hay.
Finish is a bit bitter, plants.
Good beer, but not the level of the 12.

Flaska från Demolenshop drucken med ölföreningen. Flaskan hade passerat BBD med tre månader. Lätt brettdoft och lite småunket vindsförråd, jäst och hö. Lätt kropp, torr, stram, lätt beska, citronskal. Lit för lite humle kvar men ren och elegant. Måste få tag på en färsk och prova.

UPDATED: FEB 22, 2014 Old rating rerated 14.09.2013, 0,33l bottle (bbd. 03.08.2013) @ home:
Nice creamy longlasting head. Aroma is fresh fruity, light malts, oranges, brett, overripe mountain berries, hay, gooseberry, citrus, apricot. Taste is fresh and slightly dry, light malts, hay, brett, citrus peel, flowers, herbs, citrus, grass. Longlasting nice bitterness. Very nice.

Bottle. Hazy yellow. Hoppy aroma. Complex taste of hops, malt, bread, light fruits and yeast. A bit dry in the finish. Okay, but overrated. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from a friend that visited the brewery. Golden color, white head. Bitter taste with citrus, toffee, hops, mango, toast, earthy notes and a bit of resin. Bitter finish with citrus, toast and ripe fruits. Exquisite belgian ale.
Lekker speciaal biertje, herkomst en exclusiviteit draagt ook mee aan de hoge beoordeling

In der Vrede Saturday 31st August 2013 on the way home from European beer extraveganza with Sarah. Aroma is earthy grassy hops with grains and wheat. Hazy translucent yellow straw pour with a persistent white head cratered. Some lace. Flavour is so unique, wheat, bread grains with a hint of rye. Then some tartness, slight citrus / berry. Assertive lingering bitterness. Palate is creamy , moderate carbonation frothes in the mouth. Some persistent grassy hop lingers. A truly unique lovely blond.
One of my favorites. Has many barley wine characteristics. But the 10 goes further. An excellent nigth-cap.

Ogolnie jest to mistrzowskie piwo trapistow St Sixtusa. Najbardziej porzadane i niespotykane z 3 odmian Westvleteren. Piwo z zielonym kapslem pachnie perfumami, cytrusami i polem pelnym klosow zboz. Jasny kolor zlotawy metny nawet bardzo w chwili calkowitego dolania resztek drozdzy. Znacznie sie kolor zmienia na szarawo-zolty. W smaku ozezwiajace cytrusy, zbozowo przyprawowy smak, z kolendra na czele. A finisz i zaraz po przelknieciu pojawia sie dluga koncowka, lekko gozka ale stanowczo mocno wytrawna. Wspanialy wachlaz zmiennosci smakow i bogactwo doznan. Polecam je skosztowac, o ile uda wam sie je zdobyc:)

Bottle @LasseGs place. This bottle was impregnated with some basementy notes that was pretty dominant, too bad. Slighty hazy golden with big white head. Obviously a lot of basement notes in both aroma and taste along with sweet malt, yeast and citrus.

Bottle. Yellow, slight hazy. Very nice bouquet- spicy peppery malts, soft sweet greenery, ginger, yeasty residue. Intriguing. Light medium body, coriander seeds, herbs, goldy malts. Flavourful spicyness. A very nicely spicy blond. Interesting, flavoury. Lots to savor.-- bb/wp8

Bottle 33 cl. Pours a small white head that quickly disappears. Dark golden and extremely hazy appearance with yeast floating everywhere. Sharp fruity and a bit malty aroma, I smell citrus, lemon peel and grapefruit. Sharp fruity, fresh and a bit floral taste, which is a bit earthy, dusty and woody underneath and spicy on the back of the tongue. Very complex. Long bitter aftertaste, surprisingly hoppy. Somewhat similar to Orval. Oily palate, creamy body. Very good, but just not my cup of beer.
A great belgian golden ale, balanced very good. maybe a bit overvaluated, but however very great!
Hazy goldenyellow pour with a white head. Taste is citrus/fruity, nutty, grassy yasty and flowery. Kinda like Orval but less interresting.

Cloudy golden orange appearance, strong head. Aroma reminds of freshly mowed grass. First taste is very well rounded. Semi sweet with a hint of sourness. At the end theres more pronounced bitterness. Probably the best Belgian blond style beer around. Aroma got better as the beer warmed up a bit.

Had some sips from a friends glass at In de Vrede. Hazy straw colour, good amount of white head. Lots of wort nose. Good carbonation and mouth feel makes it very refreshing and easy to drink. Low but good balance and presence of sweetness and bitterness. Aroma includes belgian style yeast, banana, some citrus. Refreshing, but with short lasting aromas. A very good blonde though.

Finalmente estou tomando uma Westvleteren e posso dizer que a espera valeu! Comecei pela blond e sim, ela é realmente boa! Ela retrata o que deve ser o estilo belgian ale, com a presença das notas de leveduras e especiarias no aroma, no sabor um amargor leve/médio muito bem inserido, um dulçor leve, notas terrosas, enfim, é uma ótima belgian ale, a melhor que ja tomei!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Meu amigo Felipe Seara me apresentou a Westvleteren. Ótimo convite. Sabor e aparência que nao deixam nada a desejar. Exemplar raro de uma belgian ale.
First thing that struck me was the flavors from the Belgian yeast. A lot of wort character. Lacy head. Very nice beer.

UPDATED: DEC 3, 2013 330ml bottle. Courtesy of Martinus. Belgian yeast, some sweet and citrus aromas. Pours hazy golden, nice white head, persistent, some lacing. Medium body, average carbonation, crispy texture. Taste is fruity, some sweet, moderate bittterness, citrus flavours. Well balanced. Dry aftertaste. Very enjoyable.Earlier Rating: 5/22/2012 Total Score: 4.1Bottle at "In de Vrede". Malty, herbal and sweet aromas. Pours hazy gold, with nice white head, persistant and some lacing. Medium body and high carbonation. Taste is moderate bitter, fruit, some sweetness, very well balanced. Nice dry finish. Good one.
Clody yellow, long lasting white head. Sweet nose, wort character. Citrus taste, moderate bitterness.

Glass at the abbey. poured a very very hazy yellow with a big pillowy slightly off white head. aroma is of straw, yeast, fresh bread, dough and something a little bitter - perhaps cheese as others have said. taste is really good. full mouth feel with malts and dough-y yeasty notes.

Bottle 33 cl, BBE 09/2014. Pours hazy golden in color with a foamy white head. Quite good looking beer, 

which leaves a nice lacing on the glass. Fruity aroma, bit of citrus, summer meadow and hints of ginger 

in aroma. Fresh cut grass in taste, lemongrass too. Nice bitterness. The finish is rather bitter with 

notes of medicinal herbs.

Bottle (2008 vintage)

Appearance: Slightly cloudy straw

Aroma: Very effervescent bananas and other light fruits

Taste: Slightly sweet with flavors of fresh fruit; bananas, apples

Palate: Medium/Light body with a fairly lively mouthfeel. Smooth finish with a slight pepper sensation

Overall: Amazing aroma and flavors; very enjoyable and complex for a relatively light ABV.

UPDATED: JAN 4, 2014 Pours yellowish and clear like a regular ale with a thin head and lively carbonation. Very subtle nose. Taste is light, as is its mouth feel, without any big pounding flavours: honey, grass, citrus fruits and hops are distinguishable. Very good balance between bitterness, sweetness and hop/citrus sourness. Nuanced.

Bottle thanks to Steve at Kickbacks... thanks, man! Golden blonde pour with a small khaki head. Light biscuity aroma and flavor, nice pale malts, some fruity esters with citrus and some apple/pear, light yeast spiciness. Tasty stuff!

I had this beer in the cafe at St. Sixtus, In de Vrede (tap?), and several months later in bottle from abbey marked 02.06.13. The beer seemed to have benefited substantially from time in bottle. The bottle was significant;y rounder and integrated with more character from yeast and malt evident through hops. It was complex and with a rather long finish.

This poured a cloudy yellow with a white head. Aroma was grass, light cheese, perfume, and yeast. Flavor was clean pale malt, yeast note, very light cheese funk, and citrus peel finish. Good not great.
UPDATED: JUL 24, 2014 Not as good as the 12 and 8, but still a good trappist. Its fresh and tasty, but will always be the warming-up to the 8 and 12.
Lemony, fresh aroma. Aroma and taste reminding of Orval but more subtle and complex.

Bottle to glass. Pours a cloudy golden light orange color with a thin white head. Aroma has notes of wild yeast and spices, with a faint hint of citrusy hops. Flavor is full of yeast and spice with a mild malty sweetness. Good body for a blonde with a lasting oily yeasty sweetness. Not the most educated on belgian styles, but probably my favorite blonde so far.
from notes.. poured at the vrede. smell of citrus, hops and some spices (pepper). taste is a bit bitter from the hops. with a nice citrus fruit taste.

What is this? Trappist Light? It pours a pale gold colour, plenty of haze, and a big white cap. Yeast, malt, and sugar make up the bulk of the aroma although some other funk can be discerned. Flavour is slightly sweet, yeasty, and finishes bitter. I expected better from Westvleteren.

Colour light yellow , yeast banana citrus lemon and malt aromas , taste is balanced with light body , notes of malts lemon , citrus , characteristic belgian yeast , banana. Finish is fresh with a biscuit taste 

Not the best of the kind (like XII) but its a decent stuff

clear effervescent straw gold, with a decent bubbly head that fades but leaves a ring.  amazing yeasty nose.  strawberry, apple, pear, and grape, with a honey malt note giving you a hint of how itll taste.  which is quite good.  dry, light honey and cereal malt augmented by the same yeastiness from earlier.  very dry finish, if it would even wait for the finish.  complex, dry, yeasty, and never even approaches overbearing on any of its many characteristics; it has a rather delicate taste.

Cafe in de Vrede, April 2013, fresh comparison of all three Westvleteren. Hazy golden with a lasting white head. Complex aroma of spice and fruit, with apple, pineapple, banana, pear, cinnamon, coriander and cardemum, along with fresh herbal hops. Sweetish fruity flavour with spicy notes, herbal and grassy hops and a good bitterness
Heerlijk mooi exclusief blond biertje. Helaas niet super doordat de afdronk wat bitter is. Geld niet waard.

Colour: Pale Gold
Nose: Very rich with citrus, lemon, raisins, malts, toast and banana.
Flavours: Smooth bitterness, creamy, vanilla, variety of fruits.
Finish: Long, fresh and slightly sweet.
Verdict: Unbelievable - Possibly the best Blond I ever had.

UPDATED: MAR 30, 2014 June 2013 - Chilled bottle.  Pale yellow, high carbonation, fluffy white head endures.  Lemony yeasty smell.  Foamy in the mouth.   Taste is medicinal, yeasty, bitter citrus, some sharpness, dry crisp bitterness to finish. (3.5)
Mar 2014 - Cold bottle.  I forgot I had this, so its 6 months past its best before date.  Pale yellow, highly sparkling, big foamy white head endures.  Aroma - flowers, cider.  Body is medium, quite foamy, medium carbonation.  Taste - sweet lager, softly sour and hoppy, white wine minerals.  Light and crisp.  Refreshing.  Hasnt deteriorated despite the age.  (3.5)

Bottle @ home. Picked this up somewhere in the lowlands. The pours clear light gold with a massive rocky white head. Light dandruff. The nose is light banana. Spicy belgian yeast. A bit of pepper, toasted herb and grain. Pear juice, some syrup. Pleasingly balanced bucolic aromas. The taste is cracked pepper on sheet cake. Light honeyed fruits. Slightly husky bitterness on the finish. Delicate sweetness. Light body, quite active carbonation. Overall, quite solid. Not a style of beer Id return to regularly, but this is undoubtedly well rounded stuff.

Pale golden colour with a good formation of a white head with very good duration and nice lacework. Aroma is yeasty with citrus notes and light floral hoppy. Flavor is very yeasty, citrus notes, perhaps slightly sourish, floral hops and slightly spices are present. The final is fresh, with a good bitterness and compensated with a weak sourness. Lively carbonation.
Bottle from Belgium in a Box; clear light amber pour with medium creamy white head, slightly funky aroma, quite fruity taste with a hint of citrus,  very crisp tasting.

Thanks to bytemesis for sending this bottle my way. Hazy golden color with a white head. Aroma is light barnyard funk with some lemons and other citrus notes. Also get some yeast character in the aroma. Flavor is similar. I get some biscuit and light toffee notes, as well as some yeast and light barnyard. Also get some lemon and a little bit of white pepper. Thin mouthfeel and medium carbonation.

Pours hazy golden yellow with a thin white head. Nose of grass and straw. Taste adds slight clove. Body is solid. Perhaps I need to seek a seat with the monks... Instead of working for my shat for brains boss.

UPDATED: JUL 3, 2013 33cl bottle at home. Tasted blind. Shared with Mathieu87.
Appearance: light clouded blonde beer, small stable white head.
Nose: bitter, quite hoppy, little fruity.
Taste: very bitter, rather fruity.
So in total, this reminded me of an IPA, but a little more balanced. Very good beer!

15 CL glass at Trappist- en Kaasproeverij Hamont-Achel at  18-05-2013, Blond beer with a hoppy aroma(citrus), taste was good but nothing special. Dont call be a Blasphemer but there are better beers out there.

From bottle - served in a glass - at the in De Vrede restaurant in Westvlederen. Poured hazy golden yellow with a large white head. Aromas of citrus, clove, yeast and hops. So balanced and smooth. Good hoppy finish.
(Bottled 2011) Aroma: Citrus, yeast, white nut  Appearance: Golden hazy, quite big carbonation, but no fizz in the beer  Taste: Blossom, citrus, grass, dry bitterry finish.

Poured from a 11.2 ounce bottle, thanks to my wife. This is a four year old bottle. The aroma is filled with honey and slight floral. The tastes is honey and slightly floral, very similar to the aroma. Showing signs of oxidation, but it has held up well. Carbonation is on the high side.

UPDATED: FEB 18, 2016 Relate on 2/18/16. The aging on about 3 years gave the a appearance of sediment in the bottle. The flavor is more fruity and sweet, but otherwise unchanged. Still one of the best Westy beers. The aroma is barnyard, lemon, pepper.  The appearance is a hazy yellow, slight orange tinge, fluffy white head.  Sentiment in bottle.  The flavor is lemon, fruit, pepper, barnyard.  The finish is pepper, other spices.  Medium in body, lots of carbonation.  Best of the Westy beers, imho.

330 ml bottle, savoured at numerous occasions. Pours gazt tellow with a small creamy head.Aroma of sweet malt, summer flower field, citrus peel. Light body with malt anf honey aroms. Okay, but not more than that.

Tasted from the bottle, bottled on 19/20/2011, in Copengagen.
Pours ultra hazy pale orange color with s fluffy head.
Aroma is amazing, peppery, spicy, honey and flowery - very complex.
Taste is even more interesting, a bit too honey sweet, but still has a lots of spices and tart fruits.
Quite unusual aroma, lovely taste, definitely - 
Recommended.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

shared by irtalian guys at kulminator 
pours blonde, big white foam. smells malty, tastes malty as well. not too complex, to be honoust..

Pours foggy light amber with low white head
Aromas of apricots, peach, belgo yeast, wheat
Mmm, nice fresh well balanced almost a bit hoppy. Peachy, bit bready and biscuity. Wee bit too much carbonation but overall very good Belgian Ale.
Drunk at In de Vrede in Westvleteren. Color blurred yellow. Smell of hops. Taste is Hoppy and has something of coriander.

Mild aroma with a straw yellow pour, very smooth taste and mild but satisfying mouthfeel.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Blonde troublée par une multitudes des particules en suspension, où un col de mousse blanche se résorbe lentement en laissant de beaux motifs aux parois. Ce qui parvient au nez en premier, ce sont les levures sauvages, le fruit de la passion, des effluves florales des plus odoriférantes et un vent de ferme agricole. Un goût acidulé et épicé qui séduit les papilles gustatives et laisse une douce et agréable amertume en bouche. La levure est omniprésente. (514-220213)

From bottle - served in a glass - at the in De Vrede restaurant in Westvlederen. Poured hazy golden yellow with a large white head. Aromas of citrus, clove, yeast and hops. So balanced and smooth. Good hoppy finish.

Not bad but not as good as I expected. Had at cellar temperature poured from the bottle into a Westvleteren tulip glass. beautiful clear gold color with a thick creamy white head. aroma is grassy with a hint of hops. Taste is similar, I expected more malt flavor. great texture. great carbonation. good blonde worth finding to try. this was a fresh bottle I picked up last weekend so Ill review again once the others have aged some! Its one I would drink again on a warm day!

A glass at In De Vrede. Maybe 2 glasses. Hazy golden and yellow with medium white head. Nose : hay, dairy, pepper. Clove and some delicate citrus. Sip : low to medium density with decent carbonation. Creamy. Delicate sweet with perfectly balanced hop peppery and yeast creamy cheese. Delicate acacia and honey notes as well. Slightly dry and spicy. Perfect body and balance in aromas. Great drinker.

Pours a beautiful golden beer, white head what didn't last very long. 
Smells are great. I don't know what I smell. Floral, herbs. A bit glue. 
The taste is awesome. I really like the bitterness. The palate is good. Nice lively carbo. A bit fizzy on the end. Medium body which is nice for a so low abv. Sticky texture.

Thank you to Tim for the gift. Drink by 15.11.13 on the green cap. Enjoyed at 50 F in a stemmed wine glass.

A -  Poured a bright blond into the glass but I was not conscious of the yeast sediment which clouded things up a bit. 3 finger pillow top fluffy head that faded slowly to a single finger with nice lacing.

S - Nose is very yeasty with a hint of honey and floral aromas. A certain spiciness as well. 

T -  Wow. This is an impressive blond. Yeast and bread notes dominate followed by a root like taste of spice and hearty potatoes. Sweet and dry finish. There are some raisins and cloves along the middle with some coriander and hoppy bitternesss of ruby red grapefruit. 

M - Medium body with a nice carbonation on the mouth swish. Doesnt stick around too long. 

O - Drinks closer to a saison than a Blonde ale
Bottle from beer planet shared with wife on last night in brussels. Very much like leffe blonde in every way. Lazy rate. Great beer.
30/3/13 In de vrede: golden hazy color with white head. Nice spicy and fruity aroma. Light sweet with pleasant spicy flavour.
Yeasty wheaty nose. Pale large head. Slightly hazy pale golden color. Fresh hoppy and grapefruit taste. Also some lemon. At the end hoppy bitterness. Well balanced good beer.
At In de Vrede. Honey in the nose and flavor. Easy drinking, could have quite a few if these. None to take home, though.
One of the best blonde beers I have ever tasted. You can smell the herbs and you have to drink this one chilled.

Pours a sunny yellow with white fizzy head. Aromas are citrus, some yeast, and buttery notes as well. Some lemon, and brett flavours, also some herbal notes and a bitter citrus finish. Very ineresting, and nice.

Bottle. Clear yellow with a large good lacing lasting bubbly white head. Aroma is dominated by banana, but also has light notes of lime, grass, hay, flowery hops, wheat, spices. Taste is medium sweet and light bitter. Light/medium body, oily texture, medium carbonation. Light dry finish with long lasting light flowery notes.

330ml bottle courtesy of MrHangover. Thanks Johan! Pours murky straw colored similar to a Witbier with a huge pillowy white head. Aroma of dry malt and some wheat. Kind of sour and yeasty, with spices, and lots of citric notes. Taste is dry and sour with notes of citrus, pepper, wheat, and belgian yeast.

Off the charts for the style, I would like in a very cocky way to all my fans thank myself for bringing this one of 15 bottles home from Belgium 3 years ago. Pours almost perfectly clear deep yellow with a beautiful creamy white head. and some decent lacing going on as well. The aroma is so pleasant, candy yeast so much nicer than the norm from most other breweries...how do they do it!? The flavor brings stringent yeast, almost funky and definitely sweet, so enjoyed on the palate like the smoothest, most pleasant fungus that has every tempted the tongue. The body is quite bubbly at first, but settles just right to enhance instead of dominate the flavor.

Uploading old ratings that were missing comments. An incredible beer that probably doesn't get enough attention. Incredibly delicate and refreshing. Lots of floral and yeasty notes. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Very light straw colored pour.  Nice white head.  Nose is very bready and yeasty with maybe a touch of fruit.  Taste is sweet bready malts and Belgian yeast.  Very clean dry finish.  Another great one.  

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
janitors .. . pours a deep yellow . .. medium head, strong lacing .. . yeast, earth, and mild honey dough .. . light mouth .. . very nice ale .. . . he didnt say science... he said, um, pie pants!

Had on draft at the cafeteria across from St Sixtus.  Pours golden orange with a thick white head.  The is tropical fruit, some hay and the great belgian candy signature.  The taste is mostly balanced maybe just a little on the sweet side but that doesnt take away from it.  Excellent.  The mouthfeel is crisp and clean, the body is heavy and the finish is long.  This is hands down just as good as the other two!  Love it.

E con questa ho finito il giro delle Westvleteren. Sono birre che non a caso hanno conquistato la fama di essere le migliori al mondo. Questa seppur sia una birra di soli 5,8° ha un intensità di gusti e di note aromatiche davvero incredibile. Aroma; ci ammalia subito con un acidità agrumata (quasi da sour ale), poi emergono le note floreali e un resinoso di luppoli. Al palato, come anticipato, ha un intensità mostrusa. Mediamente carbonata le note acide spariscono se non per sparuti sentori agrumati e citrici. Fruttata, floreale (fiori secchi); complessa, elegante. Chiude con un luppolatura resinosa. La più spensierata e beverina tra le sue sorelle. Tutte e tre, sono birre, comunque, che un vero appassionato non deve lasciarsi scappare.

Bready, lightly spicy nose. The texture is wonderful, puffy, mellow and satisfying. Pretty heavily carbonated. Lightly lemony, some coriander style soap. Perfect breakfast beer really. Perfect crest of nice wheaty looking head. Plenty of sweetness, then a solid, dry finish. I am a huge fan of this.
UPDATED: MAR 8, 2013 Bottle poors cloudy. Smell is citrus. Taste is very creamy. A very refreshing beer.

UPDATED: OCT 2, 2013 Westy 12 and 8 really hog the spotlight, but this Blond is probably one of the best I have ever had. Finally got a chance to taste a couple bottles on a recent trip to Belgium (Jan. 13), and it really surprised me. For such a "light" beer, it sure does pack a lot of flavor. Slightly hazy and pale gold with great lace patterns. Effervescent and fluffy on the tongue. Sweet, cakey nose. Surprisingly hoppy flavors and aromas, with a healthy bitterness to balance things out. Hints of fruit surface here and there (pear, apricot, white grapes). Tastes like it was dry hopped, too. Malt side, meanwhile, had a delicate complexity that weaved in and out of the yeast esters wonderfully. Delicious beer.

Bottle (from tasting session notes). Great aroma of cookies, bread dough, yeast, and a touck of funkiness. Wonderful initial to mid: banana / hop / grapefruit. So smooth. Mild finish, understated, but still full of flavor. Dry finish, with little hits of lemon and residual hops. Maybe a better blond....there isnt.
bottle at Abbey. Golden pour, fruit forward flavor, fuller mouthfeel. Great blonde ale

UPDATED: OCT 5, 2014 Bottle in the lobby. Pours clearish yellow with a fine, white head. Sweet biscuity malt nose, some dough. Medium sweet flavor, light lemony citrus, sugary dough. Medium bodied with fine carbonation. Sweet finish, dough, light funk, dough. Very tasty. (February 2013, Score: 3.8)Bottle at In de Vrede - Westvleteren, Belgium. Pours light hazy yellow with some sediment and a mild white foam head. A bit of yeasty dough in the aroma. Lovely flavor with fine doughy malts, straw, biscuits. Light to medium bodied with fine carbonation and smooth texture. Moderately sweet on the finish with creamy, doughy bread. Nice, I love it. So drinkable. (March 2013, Score: 4.0)

2013/02/23 - Pours a cloudy straw color with visible particulate and a thin white head that laces nicely. Aroma is wet dough, yeast, citrus with an earthy funk. Taste is citrus sour up front with a funky, slightly  dry floral finish. Similar funky notes to the orval with lots of carbonation. A very nice blond.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: FEB 17, 2013 cloudy amber colour with yeast particles, minimal white head; aroma of yeast, citrus and bread;spicy  taste of hoppy bitterness, and citrus;dry aftertaste; really great beer; and, of course, many thanks to Bud Taste, who provided it.

330 ml bottle from Bieropholie, served at cellar temperature in a tulip glass. 
App.:  Deep yellow, lots of floaties, large, bright white head.
  
Aroma:  Spicy and peppery, plenty of citrus, earthy coriander notes, a touch of Brett funk, yeast and wet bread dough, a little floral, honey-like, sweet, ok, I guess.
  
Palate:  Medium body, relaxed effervescence.
  
Flav.:  Sweet honey-like notes, slightly subdued citrus/spice, a bit of biscuit, still a fair bit of yeast, a touch herbaceous, more enjoyable than the nose; off-dry with minimal bitterness and a pleasant biscuit/honey/lemon cookie finish.

Well-made.  Glad to have tried it.  Likely wont seek out any more.

Hazy gold/amber pour.  a thumbs worth of head.  Aroma of hay, spice, lemon, some barnyard funk, Citrus fruit rinds.  Lemon rind and spices up front, giving away to old leather and hay.  Medium body, well carbonnated even after a couple years of age.
Floral aroma. Some spices. Very soft palate. Decent carbonation. Hints of grains.
Amazing brew smooth dark with enough hops to stay entertained and enough zest to keep you guessing

I just had this beer and i have to accept its absolutely one of the best beers I ever tasted. Only the Sint Bernardus 12 seems to be close. The taste is very full and has a kind of wooden taste. The Westvleteren 8 is absolutely more fruity, but less exceptionnal. I absolutely recommend the beer and the website that helped me to get the beer for a good price (even if i dont know if this is allowed in my review: http://westvleteren12.webs.com/ ) Enjoye

UPDATED: AUG 7, 2016 33 cl bottle @ home. Rated on 06.03.2010
Aroma is slightly tart with fruity notes, apples and floral notes. Flavour is slightly sour and funky with some earthy notes, herbs, citrus and some slightly tart apples. Finishes dry with some hops. Rather nice and refreshing  but not that nice that Id pay 10 of this again.
8-3-8-3-17=3.9

33 cl bottle @ home. BBE 04.05.2017
oops, looks like I did pay 10 of this again!
Aroma has funky yeasty notes and fruits  quite typical to a blonde belgian ale. Foamy palate. Flavour has funky yeasty tones, fruits and . Finishes with mild grassy hops and hints of minerals. Refreshing, balanced, rich and nothing disturbing here. Even drinkability is great once the foaming settles a bit. Was the price cheaper this could be the perfect summer thirst quencher.
8-3-8-3-16=3.8

33 cl bottle.
Originally rated on 20100513.
Pours hazy golden color with a medium sized head. Aroma of yeast, mild spices, lemony fruits and some toffee. Flavor of yeast, some malts, toffee and caramel notes, spices and hay. Nice.

04.01.13. Bottle. White, large, uniform foam. The beer itself is a clear straw color, looks like pale lager. Aroma is a bit oaky/apple, citrusy, refreshing. Tastes bitter, some sugar, flowery hops, a wee bit of soap; refreshing overall. Quite drinkable, as the carbonation isnt that high. Aftertaste is flowery hops.A pleasant, refreshing beer that lacks sweetness in my opinion. There are plenty better blonde Belgians out there.

A slightly cloudy, dark yellow beer with a medium and blond head. Aroma of fruits, green and sour apples, some honey and flowers. Taste of fruits, honey, lots of herbal bitterness, some peppers, also quite dry malts. The aftertaste is quite long, dry and spicy. With yeast smoother and peppers are milder. Medium- bodied, lots of carbonation, fresh to drink. Quite dry and spicy beer, the complex as expected.
Comparada con sus dos hermanas defrauda, igual debería tomarla un día ella sola únicamente. De todas formas, estaba rica.

Bottle from Beer Mania (Brussels, Belgium)
Aroma: Citrus, spicy, hay, and some floral aromas.
Appearance: Hazy, light amber, with a nice white head.
Taste: Fairly mild. I was expecting more of a punch, but its really quite drinkable.
Palate: Medium bodied, lively carbonation, with a bitter finish.
Blondes are my least-favorite Belgian style, but I had the opportunity to try this one, so I did, and was happy to have done so.

Geel, beetje troebel vooral door de gistresten, met goede witte schuimkraag die een vrij dikke laag overlaat. Geur van citroen(taart) en wat banaan en brood. Smaak is licht citroen, wat kruidig met wat gist. Beperkt koolzuur en iets romigere aanvoel dan gemiddeld. Het is een vrij simpel bier, maar heeft toch meer diepgang dan je in eerste instantie merkt. 

Aldus Huubs.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Cloudy golden yellow with small white foam head. Aroma is kind of sweet caramel with bitter tones. Taste is bittersweet with good dry bitter aftertaste. (Velp 201212)

La mejor blond que he podido probar, sin más. Aunque escasa de aroma tiene un color y un cuerpo que invitan. Sin excesivo dulce y con el alcohol muy bien integrado se bebe con mucha facilidad, pero deja un gran recuerdo. Excepcional.

Botyle. Pours cloudy yellow to orange with thin but lasting white head. Aroma is grapefruit, yeast, hops, lemon. Flavor is malt, yeast, hops, citrus fruits. Bitter but also slightly sour. Pretty excellent stuff, reminds me of Orval.

Pours a hazy light yellow with a medium carbonated and lacy head. The aroma is spicy yeasty with hints of lemon and a touch of funk and a little bready.
The taste is a lemony clovy spicy bready base that dries quickly and leaves you with a yeasty clove with some bitterness. The mouthfeel is medium with an effervescence from the carbonation.  

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Dark honey yellow with a thin white head. A lot of sediment floating around the glass. Lovely aromas of hops, malt, grass, honey, banana, citrus. Taste: creamy with medium carbonation. Tangy and sweet with the citrus dominant.

Another great beer.

33cl bottle scored via secret Santa.  Pours a very hazy, honey yellow with some lacing white head.  Very pleasant aroma, apricot, honey, grass, lemon, hay, floral.  Flavor is sweet, honey comb, chrysanthemum, light lemon, straw.  Medium bodied, dry, slightly creamy finish.  What can you say?  This beer has soul.
Not so delicious, I expected more NIce foam though and nice features but in taste was a little missing soemthing.

Great aroma on the moment when you open the bottle. It smells great while pouring it into the glass. It smells a little bit fruity in the beginning, but then you can smell herbs of all kinds, like a "ricola" candy. You can also taste a lot of herbs. I didnt pour in the last bit to avoid the bitterness, and i used to drink it on a room temperature for the full aroma and taste.

Geweldig aroma op het moment dat de fles wordt geopend. Het ruikt heerlijk op het moment dat je het inschenkt. Het ruikt fruitig in het begin, maar je ruikt ook allerlei soorten kruiden, zoals een "ricola" bonbon. Je proeft ook een heleboel soorten kruiden. Ik heb het laatste restje niet ingeschonken om de bitterheid te verkomen, en ik heb het bier op kamertemperatuur gedroken voor de volle smaak en aroma.

Bottle in the cafe In De Vrede across the road from the abbey. Aroma slightly banana, touch yeasty, notes of soft grass, in a nice way. Appearance is spot on, opaque yellow, great lace in a nice head. Taste is slightly wheaty, nice banana notes, not too strong, not bad yeasty characters from the stereotypical Trappist yeast around Belgium (same as Orval and Westmalle, and others). Palate is pleasantly bitter but not empty of sensations, a good feel. Overall, this beer is simple yet complex and layered - cant actually fault it - almost angelic in its profile. A delight to drink.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from North Bar, Leeds. Pours a hazy-ish good, finger of head, from the classic featureless, monolithic bottle. Aroma is wonderfully complex - peach, apricot, jam, banana, tropical fruits, perfume, flowers, hop spice. Taste is surprisingly delicate, but rewardingly subtle - all these features are still there but in a different hierarchy. Medium body, long flavourful finish. Just a gorgeous Belgian beer - how do Westvleteren do them so well?

33cl bottle from Kurt,Belgiuminabox.Cellared for 18 months.
Pale golden colour with medium white lasting head.
Aroma of hops and a little malt with hints of yeast.
Medium bodied with hoppy taste and some sweetish malt.Merest hint of something spicy too.Nice hoppy aftertaste.Need to try this one again to get a better handle of it but a good beer nonetheless.
No aroma. Milky yellow, full of floaties, huge head. Soft carbonation, light body, alcohol not noticeable. Musty, dry malty pear and white grape.

Bottle. Pours a slightly hazy, light golden straw. Billowy white head that seems to hang around for a while. Subtle aromas of lemons, light spice and a little bananas. Lots of yeast character. Taste is relatively sweet. Super dry finish. Medium mouthfeel. Nice
Shared from a bottle at home.  Vintage 2011,  Pours a very pale, cloudy yellow.  Aroma of library paste.  Mild belgian yeast. Short finish.
Bottle shared with Deanso. Cloudy yellow pour with a thin white head. Dry yeasty aroma. The flavour is weak bitter with a lovely smooth creamy palate. A very different and drinkable blonde.

Bottle from De Bier Tempel, Brussels (undoubtedly much to the dismay of the monks).  Cloudy honey yellow with sediment.  Head was ok but didnt last long.  Strongly sweet lemon aroma, rather like Hoegaarden.  Starts off rough and fizzy, then a dry, smooth bitter lemon which lingers on the tongue.  The overall experience is a bit one-dimensional.  Dont get me wrong, this is a perfectly pleasant citrus blonde beer but I suspect the average score is elevated by its rarity.

33cl bottle from ABCBeers shared with JMGreenUK.
Thin white head.  Clear blond pour.  Nice brew.

33cl bottle from In de Vrede Shop - a glorious looking pour, the one consistency with this stable, this one a misty orange. Very appealing nose, got some spicy banana in there, a bit of orangey citrus too. Taste has a little tang, again citrusy this time lemons come through. Its very nice, but not a patch on its two big brothers.

Purchased at de Bier Tempel in Brussels, BE; enjoyed on the last night of a long work trip at my hotel room in Eppingen, DE.  Appearance is a cloudy, vibrant bright gold with a rich, billowy white head that lightly laces to the glass.  Aroma is rich in spices, coriander, light hay, bit of pepper, smells delicate but potent.  Taste is sweet but dry, with an obvious Belgian ale yeast flavor with light floral notes, a bit of honey perhaps, lemon zest.  Its pretty damn good, nothing like the 12 but still very good.

Bottle @ Akkurat. Two completely different beers with and without the deposit. Without it has clear yellow colour, slightly citric aroma and taste like a very good german hefeweizen. With the deposit the colour turns darker and more cloudy with a heavier aroma. Taste wise it gets more of an ale character with more distinct yeast flavour.

11.2 oz. bottle, sent from Glouglouburp (thanks a lot, Dany), pours a cloudy golden blond with a medium white head. Aroma has considerable bite at about a year old, with dusty hay, some barnyard notes, leather, and delicate floral notes like a meadow. Flavour brings out the meadow above anything, really making me envision like Im sitting in a field breathing in flower pedals. Theres a bit of hay and wheat. Light-bodied and very floral. Certainly overrated by a long shot, but very pleasant, dominated by the fresh meadows and flower pedals.

My first from these monks.  Clever monks.  Pours a tantalizing orangey colour with a very nice tight foam. Bready aromas with some fruitiness.  Great mouthfeel- pears, flowers, more breadiness.  Super clean and focused.  Scarily drinkable.  Another nice treat from Jurgen.

UPDATED: FEB 2, 2013 Bouteille de 330ml avec sur la capsule linscription 07.07.12. Bue dans un calice Abdij St.Sixtus. Bière dorée avec une mousse blanche. Au nez la bière dégage tout un arôme avec des notes légères de brett et des houblons  nobles. La bouche est sublime, superbe, un abbaye davant les troupes napoléoniennes. Les notes boisées se mêlent aux houblons. La texture est ronde. Rien à redire sauf que cest superbe.

Bottle at Craigs
Straw, fairly clear, white head, some lacing
Aroma - soft bready belgian yeast, soft herbal nose
Taste - light belgian yeast, touch of bready malts, light zesty fruits
Palate - a little sharp, very dry
Overall - Wasnt impressed with this...it was too young tbh and needs a re-rate with a 1 yr old bottle

In bottle thanks Craig. Pours a blonde colour with a thick white head. Aroma of bready yeast and a vegetal courgette character before caramel, white pepper and alcohol. Similar flavours with moderate carbonation and a foamy mouth-feel. Alcohol is well balanced. Mildly bitter with a dry finish.

Sur la capsule, la date suivante: 07.07.12.  Une belle robe blonde sur laquelle flotte une mousse qui nest pas totalement blanche.  Une dentelle qui offre un petit spectacle.  Un nez très agréable de houblons floraux, herbeux et poivrés qui rencontrent une levure belge finement rustre.  Des arômes délicats dagrumes et de fruits tropicaux.  Un goût stimulé par les cultivars.  Des flaveurs de levure et la naissance de notes fruitées derrière chaque nouvelle gorgée.  Suis-je en train de boire des champs de blé?  Une campagne et ses espaces parfumés?  Une superbe bouche crémeuse et fraîche qui est bercée par des bulles douces.  Une finale amère, sèche, poivrée, funky et persistante.  Lélégant cousin du dieu Orval.

Light yellow haze. Plenty of yeast in the capitule.  Fine citrus clover aromas. Dry crisp faint spicyness. A secundary Brett sour hint! Fine brew.

33 cl. bottle poured in to a snifter. Hazy, darker golden colour with a small, bubbly head. Fruity and spicy aroma with citrus, floral hops, cloves, those Belgian yeasts, exotic sweet fruits and bread malts. A good complexity in this one.  Taste is light sweet. Medium body with an impressive thick texture compared to the abv. Average carbonation, that fits the flavour well. Long lasting, complex finish with floral and  herbal hops, citrus, sweet, exotic fruits  and a undefined spiciness. Surprisingly bitter for a trappist ale. You will not fall off your chair, as the other Westvleteren beers let you do. It lacks the superior complexity of the Orval, overall still a great experience. Highly recommended.

Bottle at Amundsen, september 9th 2012. Cloudy blond body, big foamy white head. Aroma of citrus fruits, honey, pepper and wheat. Fruity and spicy taste, orange, apple, honey and yeast. Dry finish with banana and hops.

Pours a very slightly hazy pale yellow with a big white head that falls to a thick blanket. Smell is Belgian yeast...pepper, malt undertone. Taste is nicely malty sweet up front with some spice coming next and finishing quite dry and slightly bitter. Light plus body with active carbonation yet it is still very smooth and elegant. Not a ton on the nose but certainly a very tasty brew.

33cl. Bottle. 
Poors hazy orange/yellow with white head. 
Aroma citrus, yeast, malst. 
Taste really good bitter, sweet. 
Mout-feel creamy/thin. 
Nice blond beer.

A good beer to sip whilst waiting for the brewery to open after lunch to collect your 2 crates of goodness. Can occasionally have a harsh, hoppy backtaste & at other times have a pleasant, honeyed roundness. A lasting, tight head, metallic, hops, grass & honey dominate.

Bottle at Belgian Beer Weekend, Brussels. The colour is hazy yellow with a compact off-white, whipped eggwhite-like, head. In the aroma I find citrus, pale malt and belgian yeast. Wonderful balanced fruity flavours of grass, hay, pale malt and some hops. Has a slick mouthfeel, and a below medium bitterness. A fresh, well-balanced and nice blonde ale.
Non so se preferirla alla sua sorella maggiore.... ovviamente del tutto differenti...ma da bere assolutamente! meglio sicuramente della 8 e forse anche della 6!!!! Skol
A very good blonde, but pales in comparison to its sister brews. Sweet and bready, and perfect for those who dont like the heavier styles.

Bouteille de 33 cl. Merci beaucoup à Dany et Marie-France. Arômes très floraux de houblon, belle présence de levure légèrement phénolique. Robe blonde et trouble, effervescence assez active et belle mousse qui tient bien. En bouche, la base maltée est sèche et croustillante et supporte parfaitement la levure épicée et le houblon très floral. Très belle texture veloutée en bouche. Finale sèche et moyennement amère. Une très belle blonde belge.

Bottle 330ml @ home
[Courtesy of fonefan] Pours clear golden with a with head. Aroma has notes of malt, yeast and dried fruits. Taste is medium sweet and light bitter with a long dried fruity finish. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft.
Bottle. Golden hazy pour with white head. Spices, yeast light fruit aromas. Mild sweetness, light yeast, malts and spice tones in flavor. Light but flavorful. Awesome.

Bottle, thanks to MrHangover!
Hazy, almost opaque lemonade to honey colour, off-white head leaving lacing. Some larger yeast particles in the bottom of the glass.
Aroma: grainy, bready, light pepper, fruity with pears and fresh lemon, pomerans.
Taste: I get  wheat here, also citrus, light spices and yeast, fruity, a touch of vanilla, oranges, pears.
Medium-bodied, kind of moussy.
This gives me a wit vibe, dont see anyone else describing it that way. A pretty nice one, for sure.

Bottle at home - 11/07/12. Thanks to IP trade with Wim.
Pours light yellow to blonde with a good finger of white/off-white head.
Yeasty/bready nose with background fruit and a little hop.
Sweet malt in the taste, citrus, grain and clove.
Medium body, quite a bit of carbonation and a bitter dry finish.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Cap dated 12/15/12 Pours a hazy yellow blonde with a decent white head that doesnt seem to want to go anywhere !  Aromas are tart apple, earthy spice and a bit of citrus and funky yeast. On the palate its extremely well balanced with subtitles... citrus zest, ripe fruit, earthy malt and touches of bitterness and a slght sour hint to really bring it all together.  This beer begs you to pay attention to what your drinking and really hone in on the pure balance that exists !  Yum... scored this from my downstairs neighbor as a gift when I invited him over to drink beer !  Beer Karma to the MAX.

Bottle brought from Café de Vrede at the brewery. Pours hazy dirty golden with a thick white head, that sinks to a fine layer on top of the beer.  The beer is full of residue and not spectacular to look at. But the aroma is superb. Citrus and malt sweetness, resembling an american low IBU pale ale. Wonderful. The taste lets the aroma down, more hoppy bitternes than anything else. Nothing much of malt, its a rustic pale ale. Its a good beer but  the one least worth mentioning when speaking of Westvleteren.

Une bière extraordinaire de plus, mais quoi de plus normal à Westvleteren 
Des qualités hors normes : la couleur or pur, des bulles qui scintillent comme
les étoiles dans un ciel nocturne à la montagne, une mousse blanche épaisse
avec des cratères crémeux qui se forment partout.
Des arômes qui se perçoivent à 1 mètre du verre (excusez du peu), qui 
se répandent dans la pièce, vous font percevoir des céréales, du houblon,
une belle levure et une pointe dépices, avec un rien de citron.
La lèvre trempe dans la 1ère gorgée avec une volupté sans pareille, et le liquide
vous fait parcourir les contours incroyables dun champ de blé au soleil en été.
Rien ne vaut cette impression dune vaste plaine de la Beauce sous les petits
vents chauds dété juste avant la moisson.
Léquilibre est merveilleux et se confirme sur toute la longueur avec un développement
« a mas » comme disent les Espagnols. 
La levure est parfaitement calibrée pour ce type de bière.
La finale revient sur une amertume de toute beauté, qui révèle un travail de haut vol
dans lart du brassage. 
O tempora, o mores, quand nous avons loccasion de déguster pareil breuvage.
Lesprit saint surveille toutes les bières de Westvleteren...
Et spiritus sanctus. Amen.
Mild citrus aroma, orange or something. The flavour is fruity with a good yeast note. Well-balanced.

330ml bottle 
5.8% ABV 
I tried this beer on July 26, 2012 at "Bar Volo" in Toronto, Ontario, Canada.  This completes the triumvirate of the publicly available Westys for me.  The beer poured a hazy golden yellow colour with a thin, long lasting white head.  The aroma was yeast, citrus, and some earthy tones.  The mouthfeel is medium bodied with mild carbonation.  The flavour is yeast, citrus, and light fruits with some breadiness in the malt

Bottle shared by drabmuh. Thanks Matt!

Bottle cap date: 31.03.11

A: This trappist ale is a hazy, yellow or straw hue. The beer is extremely effervescent, with bubbles rising in rapid ascension to the surface. There, the bubbles encounter a mammoth head seemingly comprised of sea foam and whipped meringue.

S: The aroma is potent, wonderful and full of bitter hops in the Belgian style, a la Belgian IPA.

T: This beer tastes fabulous. I am pleased, but not surprised, as I consider Brouwerij Westvleteren to be one of the finest breweries on the planet. There is a slight funk and/or yeastiness that adds another layer of complexity. There is a strong hop presence throughout the aroma and every step of the taste. Its also worth mentioning that this 5.8% Belgian pale ale was bottled nearly two years ago and held up like a champ. Absolutely delicious.

M: The finish is of bitter hops, with crisp carbonation throughout. The feel is somewhat dry, as well.

D: What a great beer. Im so glad to have tried it. Highly recommended.
the beer has a powerful, herbal hop aroma, with a soft smooth, light body and an intensely appetising, perfume dryness.

Bottle....at In de Vrede...at the monastery.....It pours clear yellow/golden with a large white head.....The aroma is citrus, Belgian yeast and spices....The Flavor is also Belgian yeast, hops, citrus and some spices.... Very nice.......
UPDATED: JUL 19, 2012 Golden yellow, white head. Floral aroma with tones of citrus, hay, very well balanced. Very clean taste. Soft hop bitterness in the aftertaste.

Had on tap at the Trappist.  Pour is a bright golden orange with yellow edges.  The head is creamy white leaving a thick lace.  The nose has a subtle yeast, light spice, lots of lemon zest and light floral hop in the back.  The taste has a faint spice, lots of yeast, lemon zest, and some juicy orange cirtrus with a light hop bitterness.  Body is light and refreshing, a bit juicy and prickly carbonation.

Bottle popped on the top floor of Hotel Mirabeau in Brussels, these notes being entered as my 200th Belgian beer rating.

Pours blonde with a huge white head and great lacing on the glass. 

The aroma is leafy and herbal, very hop forward with some floral character. Generally very aromatic, a little earthy with some clean malt. 

The flavor is very hoppy and herbally bitter. Bright flavored with light notes honey and floral sweetness in the back ground. The beer is lightly spicy all around and finishes perfectly dry.

Im absolutely amazed at how much character, finesse, and hop flavor this has, it is nothing like any Abbey ale Ive ever tasted, stunning. I pretty much hate rating something this "rare" this high, but this exceeded all expectations.

Light golden color, almost like a pils. Soft white head with good carbonation.  Spicy herbs smell with subtle hops. Somewhat dry taste with a light aftertaste.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

330ml bottle. Bright gold with a fluffy head that clings on until the glass is empty. Aroma is bready with musty yeast odours, fruity, floral and lemony as well as slightly vinegary. Taste is very much like a tripel, with honey and restrained spices along with a bracing citric sharpness. The body is pretty strong but feels a bit wishy-washy at times. Apart from that theres loads going on here and so much of it is spot-on. This is my first Westvleteren and already I can see why they are so highly regarded. Cant wait to try the others.

Guess this one is infected. At least I hope so. Yellow orange little misty, big firm white head. Aroma is brett and dough. Taste is mostly brett as well, some sourness, farm and dough. I think this will need a re-rate in time.

Thx to Michiel for this one // sampled 33 cl. bottle @ Black Frés Forest BBQ // last one of the Westys that I still had to try // citrus yellow with a white head // smell is clean, touch floral, dominated slightly by spices, citrus, plenty of peel I n here as well, clean lemon // taste is quite interesting, clean, sharp, interesting Belgian yeast string running through this, lemon, zesty, spices, white pepper, touch hop & bitter in the finish,  hint herb,  touch of fruits in front, pears // carb. is touch sprizty, clean, sharp, dry // balanced, clean, easy to drink // liked this one a lot more than others, neat stuff within style
2012 - 06 - 22 330ml bottle. hazy yellow golden colour. small white head. hay in aroma. light bitter taste. dry palate. not real special.....
Got a six pack from ebay. Bottles have passed their expiry date, but anyway... Golden cloudy appearance. Medium head. High carbonation. Low sourness and sweetness. Malt, fruit, herbs, yeast aroma.

Bottle via trade, pours a cloudy golden color with thick sopay white head and awesome lacing. Aromas/Taste of cherries, grass, malt, pepper spice, pear, and orange citrus. Lingers in the mouth for days. A must try belgian ale for lovers of the style.

Have had this now many times and may just be my favorite of the three, well it is fresh anyway!
A - blonde (duh!) straw color with a decent head and quite a bit of lacing, the head lasted almost the entire beer.
S - Grassy field, a bit floural, pale malt
T - Again, grassy, crisp, a bit floural but more earthy flavors and a bit of hop kick balancing it al out.
MF - light bodied with great smooth and soft carbonation, fantastic, just as it should be.
O - Crisp, clean, refreshing, and perfect with my dinner. A beer that is better than the desciption as there is nothing that jumps out at you but it all works so wonderfully together still.

Refrigerated bottle poured at the summer Trappist tasting. This bottle is also one contributed by the ever generous Nightfall. Thank you again. Poured into a Trappist glass. Orange-ish color that leans more toward the lighter end of the spectrum with a generous white head of foam that is maintained quite well. Aroma is initially lightly tart and a touch sharp citrus, but upon first sip, the tartness thought to be found turned out to be buried in the depths of the floral, citrus, somewhat spicy flavor profile. On the tongue, this beer has some rather intense carbonation. Once it lands on the tongue, a pleasant stinging sensation lets you know this wonderful beer has made its appearance.
nice blond beer, low on alcohol so easy to drink. not very bitter good taste of coriander

UPDATED: JUL 23, 2016 Speciality that you cant find in local shops. Light, a bit cloudy golden beer. Makes quite a lot foam. Light aroma, taste is soft and sweet. Palate is average. Citrus tastes more and more while coming to the end.
With this availability, the price is high and the beer is not worth it. 

Samean utuinen, kohtalaisesti vaahtoava ja kivasti pitsiä jättävä keltainen olut. Viljainen sekä hieman mausteinen, vahvasti belgihiivainen tuoksu. Maku jatkaa samoilla linjoilla ollen viljainen sekä hieman mausteinen. Keskitäyteläinen, jopa siitä täyteläisemmän suuntaan kallellaan oleva suutuntuma. Kuitenkin raikas kokonaisuus. Onhan panimo sellaisessa maineessa, että vaikea tätä on ihan neutraalisti arvioida. Varsinkin, kun esillepanokin on kunnossa etikettömine pulloineen ja oma lasikin oli sopivasti kaapissa saatavilla.

Helle Farbe leicht trüb, gute Schaumbildung und Schaumhaltbarkeit. Es riecht hefig süß blumig. Geschmacklich ist es herb und blumig-hefig, dieser Trappist gefällt mir recht gut, aber da gibts spektakuläereres von Wetvleteren!
Test vom 27.10.2010, Gebinde: Glasflasche 	Noten: 12,10,10,11,-,10 - 10,36

Bottle 330ml.
Pours chrystal-clear pale blond whit almost no head (white). Aroma is of malt, fruits, citrus. Taste is of malt, acid fruits, hops, citrus. Bitter finish. Good carbonation. Somewhat thin. Not oustanding, maybe mine was too old? Disapointing. Maybe I had too high expectations, but I would not recommend buying this ($$$).
Bottled. Golden beer with little head. Aroma of fruits. Taste of cereals. Sweety bitter aftertaste. Carbonation is great.

Bottle 330 ml. Pours crystal clear pale blond. Aroma: malt, citrus, hops. Taste is surprisingly pilsener like. Some bitterness. Very thin and dry. Little carbonation, hoppy though not overwhelming hoppy aftertaste. Not a bad beer, but disapointing.
Bouteille 330 ml. Robe blond pâle totalement translucide. Arome de malt, dagrumes et de houblon. Le goût rappelle étrangement celui dune Pilsener. Mince en bouche et sèche. Légère carbonatation. Léger arrière-goût de houblon. Pas une mauvaise bière, mais plutôt décevante au vu de sa réputation.

Bottle 330 ml. Pours clear golden with a small white head. Aroma of pils malt, belgian yeast and slight citrus. Also slight notes of fruits. Taste pils malt and some bitterness. Thin body. Long but light bitter aftertaste. Good carbonation. Not a bad beer, but I dont understand the hype around this one.

A - pours hazy pale straw with very high white head that dissipates after 30 sec. Some yeast sediment. S - huge Belgian yeast / bubble gum aromas that over power. Cloying would be the term. Strong floral notes with some citrus. No mistaking its Belgian nature. M - interesting drier tangy mf. Expecting a sickeningly sweet beer, but was pleasantly surprised.  Lingering vegetal notes. T - citrus and cloves up front. Floral and honey notes on the palate as well. Dry light funky vegetal end. Lager notes as well. O - quite good 7-
blonde veiled. beautiful compact foam. good body. soft. intense. complex with aromas of white fruit and sugar belgium style. good but not worth the price if not to help the monks

Poured into a snifter.

5.0 A: Super pale and super clear until you get to the yeast. Two and a half fingers of creamy/frothy white head. Retention is very good and tons of lacing is left. Cant ask for much more.

5.0 S: Wow. This smells better than both of its big brothers. Great mix of fruit, spice, and a touch of funk. Big hit of green apple followed by hay and peppery spiciness. Sugary citrus orange, lots of esters, and clove underneath. Powerful and well integrated.

3.5 T: Tasty, but missing the power and integration of the nose. Surprisingly bitter as well. Hay, wet grassy, earthy and grassy hops. Light peppery spiciness. Apple fruitiness with a touch of citrus. Woodsy funk and herbal lemongrass.

4.5 M: Lighter body. Active, spritzy carbonation. Plenty of creaminess for how light it is.

4.0 D: This would have a shot at a perfect beer if it tasted more like it smelled. In any case, glad I got to try it.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 04-06-2012 01:57:05

Golden with nice soft head. Aroma hay, yeast, hops - like in a hay barn with some horse. Taste some sweet malt, more bitter hops, yeast and hay. Light/Medium body with good carb. Finish with long bitterness. Didnt appreciate the country barn taste/aroma.

Usual brown 33cl bottle, cap date 19.10.11, so drink before 19th Oct 2011. This bottle was reviewed 14th Jan 2011: poured into a Westvleteren chalice, which sat on a Westvleteren beermat, so it felt at home!

Cloudy/hazy/murky body of dirty orange/lemon colour, a white collar and wispy head on top.

Belgian yeast esters, with green hops hit the nose, some citrusy notes as well.

The taste was sharp and refreshing, almost tart in its citrus (lemon and grapefruit) bite.

I thought it a bit young in the taste, meaning it needed longer to mature in the bottle. I have two older ones in my stash, but wanted to review the beer when in date, Ill have the other ones soonest though, as this Westy doesnt age too well, or so Im told.

Pleased Ive used the glass at last and the lesser of the Brothers beers gets a thumbs up from me, not huge scores, but Im a low marker compared to most.

Aroma of yeast, lemon and orange. Taste is lemon and yeast with a slight bitterness. Mouthfeel is dry yeasty!

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone 4S

UPDATED: OCT 28, 2014 Bottle. Hazy, yellow/hay liquid with medium to big white head. Aroma is spicy with notes of banana, red berries, noble hops, wheat and cereal malt. Taste is very light, quite dry and light bitter with very light tartness. Notes of belgian yeast esters and wild strawberries. Light bodied with nice carbonation. Quite balanced and not too sweet, though quite dull. 3.6 score.
Re-rating june 2014. Bottle at In de Vrede. Fresh as it comes, and a totally different beast than the bottle I had roughly two years ago. Same appearance but so different otherwise. Freshly hoppy aroma of citrus, flowers and some light fruity esters. Very effervescent with some light malt background. Taste is dry and refreshingly bitter with noble hops dominating. Extremely quaffable and refreshing. Body is just enough to not feel watery with a high but balanced amount of carbonation. As good as pale Belgian ales come. Hoppy, refreshing and awesome. Better than both the 8 and 12 fresh.
Cloudy yellow with a thick white head. Fruity and flowery tones. Malt, fruit and hops. Medium body with a nice bitter sweet after taste.

Bottle. Light golden, hazy, average to large and mostly lasting head. Moderate, malty - lightly wheaty and sweetish aroma, fruitiness - light honey, faint spiciness (coriander, light pepper), light herbal hoppyness, some yeast. Body is medium, malty - lightly wheaty and sweetish flavor, some fruitiness - light honey, light herbal hoppyness, some yeast. Finish is average, malty - lightly malty and lightly sweetish, light fruitiness - faint spiciness, some herbal hoppyness. OK Belgian ale, but "Dont believe the hype".
Parfymerad fläderdoft. Len smak men lite för klen. Ok balans och inte för överkryddar

Ive had this beer at In de Vrede when i was there to pick up some crates with a local pub owner. The beer was slightly dissapointing. For me it was the least of the three i tasted when i was there. Found my notes on my old telephone today.
Slightly hazy pale yellow colour with a decent white head. Smells fresh, orange peel, yeast and flowers. Doesnt taste like anything special. Good, regular Belgian ale taste, but at the same time a bit thin and lacking in body.

Bottle at De Heeren van Liedekercke, March 2012.

Hazy light blond with a fluffy white head. Hmmm, not as tasty as expected. I liked the bitterness and soft sourness in this beer but there was also too much spices and perfume for my liking.

Bottle courtesy of Jesse.  Thanks!  Clear bright yellow with a fizzy white head.  Nice floral Belgian yeast, pear, light banana, and orange aroma.  Taste of citrus bread, orange, pear, and subtle banana and apple with a big doughy finish and a crisp, bright, lively palate.

Thanks to BVery, congrats on 2k!
Very pale gold/straw pour with a medium white head.
aroma is nice soft straw and lemon.
Nice pale malt body, yeast, citrusy bitterness, very drinkable.

Date: February 19, 2012 Mode: Bottle Source: BVery Description:  Semi-opaque light white pour with some head.  Aroma was primarily like a saison with a tad bit of sour.  Taste was pretty good, very drinkable.  Thanks to BVery sharing and stoked to be able to share in his 2000th rating!  Yeah booooiieeeee you rock!!!!!
UPDATED: FEB 20, 2012 Bottle. Rating #2000! Hazy yellow pour with a pure white head. Aroma of yeast, light lemon, and orange. Medium palate, Taste is lemon and yeast. Very nice.

Currently drinking while typing. After a long wait I have finally got hold of one, two of each Westvleteren variety infact! After pouring you will come across a very interesting aroma which almost smells faintly like a tin of baked beans! Fresh scents of citrus, yeast, sprucey hops, faint sugars and a generally light and delicate aroma, nothing huge although very interesting!
